Name: Cogmind
Content: That's you.

Name: Combat Drone Bay
Content: Deploys [[Combat Drone|Combat Drones]].

Name: Command
Content:
Command is an [[0b10]]-controlled [[Access]] [[Branch]] that only appears on -1. It is the home to [[MAIN.C (Shell)|MAIN.C]], the mastermind AI behind 0b10, and huge groups of his forces. Command features a heavily patrolled dense layout that feels more similar to [[Research]] than [[Access]] with smaller corridors and generally smaller heavily interconnected rooms with Emergency Accesses connecting many rooms. One unique feature of Command is that dispatched squads are not spawned from an exit. Instead, there is a dedicated "Garrison" area in the map where bots are dispatched from. This means that unlike most maps, it is possible for Command to run out of squads to send after Cogmind.

[[Heading]]Layout[[/Heading]]
The overall structure of Command can be split into 3 groups. The right and left sections are both randomly generated per seed, although there are several fixed features per each. The center section of the map is always fixed and in the same location.
[[Heading:2]]Right section[[/Heading]]
The right side of the map is more like a "normal" 0b10 floor, with most typical types of [[Interactive Machine|Interactive Machines]] available and standard [[Squad|Squads]] throughout. There are a few special machines present here, including a [[Phase Generator]] and 2 Cave Seal [[Terminal|Terminals]]. There is an extremely heavily guarded exit that is heavily trapped with [[Stasis Trap|Stasis Traps]], with 2 [[Alpha 7|Alpha 7s]], 2 [[Striker|Strikers]], 4 [[Executioner|Executioners]], and 2 [[B-99 Colossus|B-99 Colossi]] serving as guards. This section is connected to the center section at the top, center, and bottom of the map.
[[Heading:2]]Center Section[[/Heading]]
The center of the map is always fixed, with a few distinct sub-areas.
[[Heading:3]]Doom Corridor[[/Heading]]
The Doom Corridor is a 5 tile wide corridor that contains multiple unpowered Warlord variations, 2 [[Combat Programmer|Combat Programmers]] and 2 [[M Guard|M Guards]]. Trying to go farther into the map requires killing or bypassing these tough [[Prototype Robot|Prototype Robots]].
[[Heading:3]]Command "Garrisons"[[/Heading]]
Above and below the Doom Corridor are passages to the "Garrison" sections of the map. They are not the usual [[Garrison Access]] machines but do behave similarly in function, being able to dispatch bots as part of normal summoned squads like [[Investigation Squad|Investigation]], [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcement]], and [[Extermination Squad|Extermination]] squads. Each Garrison has a fixed set of bots that are initially present. Each garrison has the following list of bots:
[[List]]
12 [[B-74 Champion|B-74 Champions]]|
18 [[C-45 Heavy ARC]]|
6 [[C-57 Dissector|C-57 Dissector]]|
6 [[D-83 Annihilator|D-83 Annihilators]]|
48 [[G-73 Enforcer|G-73 Enforcers]]|
24 [[H-88 Terminator|H-88 Terminators]]|
6 [[I-47 Archangel|I-47 Archangels]]|
12 [[L-61 Swordsman|L-61 Swordsmen]]|
24 [[P-80 Master|P-80 Masters]]|
18 [[S-43 Plague|S-43 Plagues]]|
12 [[X-87 Electro|X-87 Electros]]
[[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]MAIN.C room[[/Heading]]
Above the Doom Corridor are some [[Reinforced Walls#Command|Sealed Barriers]] with 80 armor. surrounded by Reinforced Barriers with 100 armor. They are locked by a Terminal with a 60% base open chance. Past this hall is a large room with a big chunk of machinery called the 0b10 Conduit that is hooked up to MAIN.C. 100 armor Heavy Barriers appear on the bottom left side of this room that block off the left section of Command.
[[Heading:3]]Left Section[[/Heading]]
The left section is similar in layout to the right side, although it tends to be much smaller. Unique features on this side include an unguarded exit, a Wave Inhibitor machine, and a cache of high rating parts near the top-right or bottom-right side of the map.
[[Heading:2]]Special Machines[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:3]][[Phase Generator]][[/Heading]]The Phase Generator is an explosive machine with a distinctive look and is always found on the right section of Command. This Phase Generator will block most forms of bot detection and and terrain scanning. [[Sensor Arrays]] except for the [[Active Sensor Suite]], [[Terrain Scanners]], and the [[Structural Scanner]] all do not work in Command unless the Phase Generator is destroyed. [[FarCom]], however, does work even through the Phase Generator. This machine also keeps Phase Walls powered, which look just like normal walls unless destroyed or an 0b10 bot walks into one. These walls disappear when the Phase Generator is destroyed.
[[Heading:3]]Cave Seal[[/Heading]]
Cave Seals are a special type of Terminal that will spawn bots when opened. There are always 2 Cave Seals on the right side of the map. After being opened, large groups of bots will appear roughly 10 turns, 125 turns, 225 turns, and 375 turns after opening. The type of bots depend on various factions and alignments Cogmind has interacted with. See [[Command#Cave Seal Contents|Cave Seal Contents]].
[[Heading:3]]Wave Inhibitor[[/Heading]]
The Wave Inhibitor, only appears on the left section of the map. It will prevent teleportation via the [[Transdimensional Reconstructor|Regular]] and [[Hpw. Transdimensional Reconstructor|Hpw. Transdimensional Reconstructors]]. It also blocks calling for allies when [[Imprint|Imprinted]].

[[Heading]]Notable Locations[[/Heading]]
[[Gallery]]Command Phase Gen.png|Phase Generator room|Command Cave Seal.png|Cave Seal machine|Command Wild Cave Derelicts Seal.png|Wild Derelicts from a Cave Seal|Cogmind Warlord Seal.png|Warlord aligned cave seal|Cogmind CRM Seal.png|[[Core Reset Matrix]]-aligned cave seal|Command Imprint Seal.png|[[Imprint]]-aligned cave seal|Command Garrison.png|Command Garrison with many dormant bots|Command DoCo.png|Doom Corridor with M Guards, Combat Programmers, and unpowered Warlords|Command MAIN.C.png|[[MAIN.C (Shell)|MAIN.C]] room|Cogmind Wave Inhibitor.png|Wave Inhibitor machine|Command Cache.png|Cache of strong high-rating parts|Command Right Side Surface Exit.png|Right side Surface exit|Command Left Side Surface Exit.png|Left side Surface exit|Command A0 Exit.png|Exit to [[Access_0]][[/Gallery]]
[[Heading:2]]Cave Seal contents[[/Heading]]
The contents of the cave seal depend on alignment. Warlord/Imprint alignment are mutually exclusive and take priority over Core Reset Matrix seals. If no other options apply, wild cave [[Derelict|Derelicts]] will appear. For allied seals, some of the bots will follow Cogmind around and others will roam the map randomly.
[[Heading:3]]Warlord seal[[/Heading]]
Warlord seal bots are white colored, meaning that they are allied to Cogmind but do not generate [[Alert]]. Warlord will always come out of the first opened cave seal. They can contain the following bots by default:
[[List]][[Warlord (Command)|Warlord]] (first only)|[[Butcher (7)]]|[[Fireman (7)]]|[[Guerrilla (7)]]|[[Knight]]|[[Marauder (8)]]|[[Martyr (7)]]|[[Mutant (8)]]|[[Savage (7)]]|[[Thug (7)]]|[[Troll]]|[[Wasp (7)]]|[[Wizard (7)]][[/List]]
If Warlord forces have gained a force multiplier by the [[Encrypted Comm Array]] mechanics, more bots and stronger bots will appear from these seals. If the multiplier is high enough, the following bots can additionally be found in these seals:
[[List]][[Dragon]]|[[Hydra]]|[[Surgeon (6)]][[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]Imprint seal[[/Heading]]
Imprint seals contain purple-colored bots which [[I]]will[[/I]] generate Alert for Cogmind. Be mindful of alert generation as it is extremely easy to trigger [[High Security]] very soon after opening an Imprint seal. Unlike most purple allies, some of these bots will wander off without following Cogmind. If a Core Reset Matrix has been used prior to opening the seal, any [[Experimental|Experimentals]], [[Z-Light|Z-Lights]], and [[Z-Heavy|Z-Heavies]] will be blue and controllable instead of purple uncontrollable. They can contain the following bots:
[[List]][[Fireman (7)]]|[[Martyr (7)]]|[[Mutant (8)]]|[[Wizard (7)]]|[[Z-Experimental (8)]]|[[Z-Experimental (10)]]|[[Z-Heavy (9)]]|[[Z-Light (9)]][[/List]]
[[Heading:3]][[Core Reset Matrix]] (CRM) seal[[/Heading]]
CRM seals consist only of [[Golem|Golems]] and [[Assembled (7)|Assembled]]. There is either 0 or 1 Golem per spawn, and about a dozen Assembled each time.
[[Heading:3]]Wild Derelicts[[/Heading]]
Wild Derelict seal bots are brown-colored meaning hostile unaligned Derelicts that do not contribute to Alert. They can contain the following bots:
[[List]][[Butcher (7)]]|[[Fireman (7)]]|[[Guerrilla (7)]]|[[Mutant (8)]]|[[Savage (7)]]|[[Thug (7)]]|[[Wizard (7)]][[/List]]
[[Heading:2]]Command cache contents[[/Heading]]
There are several groups of parts that can appear as part of this cache. There is one special item which contains many otherwise unique [[Testing]]-only parts, and the Gamma Refractor that can't appear anywhere else.
[[Heading:3]]Unique item[[/Heading]]
This unique item appears in the center of the cache:
[[List]][[AEGIS Remote Shield]]|[[Cld. Nova Cannon]]|[[Gamma Refractor]]|[[Hds. Centrium Heavy Treads]]|[[Hyp. Multirail]]|[[Imp. Potential Cannon]]|[[Multirail]]|[[Null Cannon]]|[[Omega Cannon]]|[[Perforator]]|[[SHELL Armor]]|[[Singularity Reactor]]|[[Z-bomb Delivery System]][[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]Propulsion items[[/Heading]]
There are 5 of these propulsion items on the right side of the cache:
[[List]][[Enh. Armored Heavy Treads]]|[[Exp. Biometal Heavy Treads]]|[[Exp. Biometal Leg]]|[[Exp. Biometal Medium Treads]]|[[Hds. Centrium Leg]][[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]Power items[[/Heading]]
There are 2 of these power items on the bottom center of the cache:
[[List]][[Vortex Chain Reactor]]|[[Zero-point Reactor]][[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]Utility items[[/Heading]]
There are 6 of these utility items on the bottom left of the cache. The bottom left one will always be an Exp. System Purifier.
[[List]][[Adv. Kinecellerator]]|[[Adv. Particle Accelerator]]|[[Adv. Quantum Shading Machine]]|[[Thermal Barrier]]|[[Centrium Heavy Armor Plating]]|[[Centrium Medium Armor Plating]]|[[Exp. Armor Integrity Analyzer]]|[[Exp. Cloaking Device]]|[[Exp. Core Analyzer]]|[[Exp. EM Shield]]|[[Exp. ECM Suite]]|[[Exp. Energy Well]]|[[Exp. Focal Shield]]|[[Exp. Force Field]]|[[Exp. Matter Compressor]]|[[Exp. Melee Analysis Suite]]|[[Exp. Target Analyzer]]|[[Exp. Targeting Computer]]|[[Exp. Phase Shifter]]|[[Exp. System Purifier]] (guaranteed, only one)|[[Exp. Transmission Jammer]]|[[Exp. Weapon Cycler]]|[[Femtoactuators]]|[[Hvy. Regenerative Plating]]|[[Prc. Energy Filter]]|[[Prc. Matter Filter]]|[[Spectral Analyzer]][[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]Weapon items[[/Heading]]
There are 6 of these weapon items in the top left of the cache:
[[List]][[Enh. Nova Cannon]]|[[Graviton Cannon]]|[[Hvy. Hardcell Cannon]]|[[Hvy. Quantum Rifle]][[/List]]
[[Heading:3]]Gaining Access[[/Heading]]
The door terminal only has a 10% chance of hacking, though this hack is only available while MAIN.C is still alive. Other methods of entry will require bypassing the Sealed Heavy Doors via Spacefold, digging through with strong Thermal damage, or digging through the side with a Matter Drive or Laser Shovel.
[[Heading:2]]Exits[[/Heading]]
There are 3 exits on Command maps. All are very uniquely identifiable:
[[List]]Right-side Surface exit: This exit is behind a 4 tile wide doorway on the right side of the map. This exit is extremely heavily guarded, with 2 [[Alpha 7|Alpha 7s]], 2 [[Striker|Strikers]], 2 [[Executioner|Executioners]], and 2 [[B-99 Colossus|Colossi]]. There are also 10 rows of stasis traps and a further layer of stasis traps surrounding the Access Shell that make flying or core hovering through a nightmare. Launchers can be used to destroy the stasis traps without triggering them manually, or a [[Stasis Canceller]] can be used to ignore them altogether. It is usually better to use a strong digging method to dig through the back of the exit to avoid most of the head-on fire.|Left-side Surface exit: This exit is on the left side of the map and can be located by a 2 tile wide corridor dead-ending in it along with Reinforced Barriers surrounding it. There are no guards at this exit.|[[Access_0]] exit: This exit can be found on the far left of the map, past any 0b10 level. There is a [[Dimensional Node Initializer]] activated here, which means that a [[Transdimensional Reconstructor|Regular]] or [[Hpw. Transdimensional Reconstructor]] will always result in coming to this exit as long as the Wave Inhibitor is destroyed. It is possible to dig to this location, although it will be very painful with many cave-ins and there is no easy way to identify where the exit is.[[/List]]

[[Heading]]MAIN.C[[/Heading]]
MAIN.C is a very unique encounter in the game. Unlike most bots in the game, he has 2 different forms. The [[MAIN.C (Shell)|base form]] is a 3x3 tile slow-moving tank. The [[MAIN.C|second form]] drops down to a 1x1 tile fast hover-bot. Both forms have an ability that regenerates 5 core integrity every turn. He has much state-dependent dialogue, and multiple interactions with different bots in Command.
[[Heading:2]]Fighting[[/Heading]]
MAIN.C will instantly attack when opening the door to his room, then monologue a bit. On defeating the first phase, MAIN.C will typically offer a choice to continue fighting or to surrender. Surrendering will start the process for a W8 [[Wintypes|Wintype]], discussed below. MAIN.C will not offer the surrender option if Cogmind has used a [[Core Reset Matrix]], if [[Warlord (Command)|Warlord]] is alive and present on the map, or if Cogmind has completed the [[UFD]] [[Protoforge]] event. If continuing to fight, the Command Garrisons will be activated, leaving the large swathes of Garrison bots to swarm around the map aimlessly. The Doom Corridor guards and the right side exit guards will also be summoned directly to the MAIN.C room, if alive. If MAIN.C is destroyed, a large percentage of all 0b10-aligned bots will turn into a new unaligned faction, hostile to other 0b10 bots. Every 200 turns, more bots will randomly switch between the two factions, continuing to destroy each other. 600 turns after MAIN.C's death, all remaining combat hostiles will turn unpowered.
[[Heading:3]]Defeating MAIN.C Strategy[[/Heading]]
See [[Strategy/Bosses/Defeating MAIN.C]]
[[Heading:2]]Warlord interaction[[/Heading]]
If phase one of MAIN.C sees Warlord, he will unpower Warlord permanently. This ability can be avoided in two ways. The first is to destroy phase one of MAIN.C before Warlord comes into view. This is only really possible for an airborne builds that can leave Warlord behind to try and fight phase one before Warlord can catch up. The second way is to use the MAIN.C hack. There are a few turns of wiggle room before Warlord is shut down, so make sure to use this hack via some kind of remote [[Datajacks| Datajack]] immediately on entering the MAIN.C room.
[[Heading:3]]W7: "Establishing Free Derelict Territories"[[/Heading]]
If MAIN.C is destroyed and Warlord is still alive and has not been unpowered, a W7 will be achieved. Using the MAIN.C hack first makes this wintype much easier to accomplish to stop the unpowering ability.
[[Heading:2]]MAIN.C Hack[[/Heading]]If [[A7]] was rescued in [[Extension]] and his quest to see the [[Cetus]] Mainframe is completed, they will provide the MAIN.C hack. Using this hack has two primary effects. It stops Warlord from being shut down after being spotted and it dramatically slows down MAIN.C's action speed. Every free turn, there is a chance that MAIN.C will be unable to move with the text [[GameText]]MAIN.C reaction time slowed by virus[[/GameText]]. This substantially decreases the amount of damage output, although it doesn't slow down any of the Command Garrison bots from running into the room quickly.
[[Heading:2]]Zhirov[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Command Zhirov.png|Zhirov, Perun, and Svarog arriving to finish off MAIN.C[[/Image]]
If [[Zhirov]]'s SGEMP quest is completed and Zhirov is still alive, he will show up along with [[Perun]] and [[Svarog]] after Cogmind defeats phase one of MAIN.C. A Modified SGEMP will be detonated, unpowering every 0b10-aligned bot on the floor. This also includes Warlord if he is present on the map. After this, Zhirov will remark that there is a lot of cleaning up to do, then he and his friends will teleport out. This does not count as a MAIN.C kill for the run (a + on the scoresheet). However, it does provide a good method to prepare for Access_0 with all of the good loot available and is generally a good way to explore Command.
[[Heading:2]][[Sigix Warrior]]/[[Sigix Exoskeleton]] interaction[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Command Sigix Shell.png|Special MAIN.C phase 2 reinforcements to fight the Sigix[[/Image]]
If Cogmind has activated the Sigix Warrior or has gotten into the Exoskeleton, MAIN.C will be much more prepared for phase 2. In addition to the second phase of MAIN.C himself, there will also be 4 [[M Shell/Atk]] and 4 [[M Shell/Def]] that appear from the outer shell. The Defensive shells are not too much stronger than an average [[Protector]], but the Offensive shells boast a ridiculously strong offensive loadout with many of the best offensive utilities in the game. Fighting them head-on is not an easy task.
[[Heading:2]]W1: "Establishing 0b11"[[/Heading]]
This wintype can be achieved by destroying both phases of MAIN.C and taking either Surface exit off of the map. If Cogmind has consumed a Core Reset Matrix, a W2 will override this win.
[[Heading:2]]W4: "Assimilated 0b10"[[/Heading]]
This win can be achieved in one of two ways using the 0b10 conduit that MAIN.C is normally hooked up into. The machine must remain intact in order to achieve this wintype. The first is to destroy both phases of MAIN.C and then stand next to one of the corners of the conduit. If using [[RIF]], MAIN.C does not need to be destroyed. Using RIF is by far the easier technique as the MAIN.C first phase is very slow and easy to lure away by a fast flight build that can hop back over MAIN.C and run into the machine.
[[Heading:2]]W8: "Fortifying 0b10"/Surrender[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Command EQ-Series.png|[[Enhanced Q-Series]] attacking 0b10[[/Image]]
If the surrender option is chosen after defeating MAIN.C phase one, a different ending will begin. First, all 0b10 bots including MAIN.C will become friendly to Cogmind with the log entry [[GameText]]LRC-V3 rejoined 0b10. Threat protocols amended.[[/GameText]] MAIN.C will give Cogmind complete map intel and say to go stock up in the Command cache, which will open automatically on approach. At this point, the Access_0 Dimensional Slip Node will explode and the exit will be closed. After 100 moves or approximately 400 turns, another two alerts will indicate [[GameText]]System intrusion detected. Garrison defenses under attack.[[/GameText]] and [[GameText]]All Command Garrisons activated[[/GameText]]. Garrisons be significantly sabotaged, and after 40 more turns, a large group of [[Enhanced Q-Series]] will teleport into random locations on the map. After every 100 turns or so, more waves of Q-Series will spawn in. These bots have randomized loadouts just like regular [[Q-Series]] do, but are much more powerful. MAIN.C will order Cogmind to fight them off. Be careful of Launcher uses and misses/misfires for this event. If 0b10 bots are attacked enough times, MAIN.C will announce Cogmind as a traitor and all 0b10 bots will once again become hostile.
The Enhanced Q-Series waves will go on endlessly without intervention. There is some amount of contribution required to be able to complete the event. The details are not well understood, but participating in kills will move the event closer to completion. Expect between one to two dozen Enhanced Q-Series kills required before the event can be completed. If Cogmind is not contributing enough, when the 4th wave spawns, MAIN.C will tell Cogmind to help out a bit more or else they might lose. After enough kills, MAIN.C will say that the reinforcements seem to have stopped coming and must prepare for the future. This will end the run and result in the W8 ending.
[[Heading:2]]Strategy[[/Heading]]
See [[Strategy/Wintypes/W8 Fortifying 0b10]].

Name: Community Challenges
Content:
This page contains alternate game challenges created by the community.

[[Heading]][[Drained L-Cannon]] (DLC) Victory[[/Heading]]
This challenge relates to redacted-tier content.
[[Redacted]]The Drained L-Cannon must be acquired in [[Section 7]] and taken to [[Command]] to kill [[MAIN.C]]. Through precise positioning and aiming, it is possible to kill both phases simultaneously. Then, it must be taken to [[Access_0]] and used to eliminate the [[Architect]]. Again, with proper aiming, it is possible to kill the Architect and the singularity gate simultaneously.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:2]]DLC Completed Runs[[/Heading]]
[[List]]
Runia [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/index.html?NqKDXkNv4e2NUuaXi|(scoresheet)]]|Runia (2nd completion) [[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V8C6bMmqdSA|(video part 1)]] [[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j3a8LcHc6p4|(video part 2)]] [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/?FX1v9SHraRBMypQBq|(scoresheet)]][[/List]]

[[Heading]]Inspector Madlad[[/Heading]]
[[FanartGallery]]Inspector Madlad.png|[[/FanartGallery]]
[[Heading:2]]Inspector Madlad Completed Runs[[/Heading]]
None yet

[[Heading]]No Info Only War[[/Heading]]
[[B]]No Info, Only War[[/B]] - Ever wondered what it's like to get a "pure" combat win without any of those pesky sensors or scanners or burner hackware, pooling all your resources not into avoiding combat or escaping the complex quickly, but into nothing but sheer, overwhelming power? Then you might be interested in this challenge!
Forbidden: Much like leiavoia's Tank it to the Top, you must use only grounded propulsion, not even core hover if you can avoid it. Strictly forbidden parts are anything listed within Cogminder as [[Hackware]] or [[Infowar]], and no [[Datajacks]] or [[Component Analysis Suites]] either! Alignment options: [[RIF]] and [[Data Conduit|DC]] are also forbidden. If you get [[FarCom]], you must aggro the [[Exiles (Group)]] before leaving the map. You are also not allowed to enter the [[Hub_04(d)|Hub]] branch map.
Permitted: Unlike Tank it to the Top, you can go wherever you want (you may not even be able to ID exits, after all!), and you can use any unauthorized hacks you know, if you can succeed with no hackware! Feel free to restrict those for extra points (the points mean nothing). Parts that don't strictly help mid-combat, but don't give intel, like recalibrators or salvage targeting, are allowed and even recommended. Alignment options: [[Encrypted Comm Array|ECA]], [[UFD]], [[Core Reset Matrix|CRM]], and [[Imprint]] are fine.
Objective: Surface exit. Extended is bonus points!
[[Heading:2]]No Info Only War Completed Runs[[/Heading]]
[[List]]
aoemica [[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t6r8d4V9lKw|(video)]] [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/?5wSoxrLwbPipVWytY|(scoresheet)]]|
Captain Winky [[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4PlqRi522U|(video)]] [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/?CrYjCg31pBNi8XSEs|(scoresheet)]]|
Darby [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/?go3wEVTNs5Z9yFzSU|(scoresheet)]]|
Kyzrati [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/?rt5egdPNGK6jg2zk3|(scoresheet)]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Tank It To The Top[[/Heading]]
leiavoia's "Tank It To The Top" Challenge -  Showing just how hard is it to play combat treads from a new-player perspective. Think you're tough? Give it a try!
Da Rulez: You have to take a combat build (treads recommended, but any grounded propulsion type is allowed) through a "straight shot" run. You may not take any branches, including [[Mines]], [[Caves]], [[DSF]] and [[Garrison|Garrisons]]. [[Wastes|Waste]] [[Chute Trap|Chutes]] are allowed. Access surface exit is the goal ("W0"). This challenge is meant to be "spoiler free", so you may not use any "unauthorized" terminal hacks that would be unknown to a new player (no botnets!). You can wear other prop in an emergency, but not as an alternative, and not as "hover treads".
Background: It turns out that doing this is really difficult. I wanted to make a n00b-friendly combat how-to, but keep getting my bot kicked. Attempts at doing this lately all burn down when alert finally catches up. Treads builds desperately want to escape to branches, but when there are none, you need to find a different method. Let me know if you make it work, and bonus points if its on video. Happy treading!

CaptainWinky [[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wmgx4KqNDtk|(video)]] [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/?ULLgnw8djhgafSLZe|(scoresheet)]]|
KTG-V3 [[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Pto2Nddnd8|(video)]] [[https://leiavoia.net/cogmind/dataminer/?6RdhT6MNbTHGtjkBM|(scoresheet)]]|

Name: Companion Sword
Content:
The Companion Sword is a unique talking melee weapon that can only appear in [[Scraptown]]. It is contained in a room called The Sword, locked for the protection of [[Derelict|Derelicts]], none of whom have survived using the Companion Sword for long. The Companion Sword is quite talkative and will often comment about the state of the run, take pleasure in destroying things, and complain if it is detached or is not the only weapon attached. The Companion Sword has a variety of special effects that are not described by the in-game effect.

[[Heading]]Special Effects[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]
Effect|Description|Frequency||
Surprise Attack|The Companion Sword will "surprise attack" one additional target on a normal attack. Can only happen if there is at least two hostiles are within melee range. The log message [[GameText]]Companion Sword surprise attacks [target].[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Uncommon||
Core Loss|The Companion Sword deals between 5-10 core damage directly to Cogmind's core on a normal attack. Can't be reduced by [[Core Shieldings]] or [[Defensive Utilities]]. Only happens when Cogmind attacks something with the Companion Sword.|Uncommon||
Bot Disruption|A bot is instantly disrupted on a normal attack. As with normal disruption, a disrupted bot can be rewired as long as it isn't hacking immune. The log message [[GameText]][target] shuts down.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Rare||
Sever|A part is severed off of a bot on a normal attack. This effect can hit through the Dismemberment immunity, unlike standard Sever critical hits.|Rare||
Surge of Energy|This effect instantly kills a bot on a normal attack. The log message [[GameText]][target] is pierced by a surge of energy.[[/GameText]] will appear when this happens.|Rare
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Transformation[[/Heading]]
The Companion Sword can transform into the [[Quantum Companion]] in one of two ways:
[[List]]Use: The transformation can occur from time wearing and use. Killing bots while keeping it equipped for a long period of time will make it transform the quickest.|[[Subatomic Replicator]]: The Replicator can instantly create the Quantum Companion from a Companion Sword.[[/List]]
When the Companion Sword transforms, the following game log message will appear: [[GameText]]Companion Sword blips out of existence for a moment, then partially fades back in.[[/GameText]] The Companion Sword will also comment on it, saying one of multiple possible [[Companion Sword#upgrading|upgrade lines]].

[[Heading]]Dialogue[[/Heading]]
The following is a non-comprehensive list of Companion Sword dialogue:
[[Comment]]If you turn on "log output" during a Companion Sword run, your entire run's log (including all Companion Sword dialogue lines) will be exported as a txt or html file after the run ends or when creating scoresheet dumps.
Having such a file and using Ctrl+f to find the dialogue lines can make it significantly easier to add missing dialogue lines you might have encountered to this list.
You don't need to do this, but you can.[[/Comment]]

[[Heading:2]]All variants[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:3]]First meeting before pickup[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]You know you want me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I've been waiting for you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Why hello there. are you here to rescue me?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Want to be a hero? Pick up the sword.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You and I were meant for greatness.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Just do it. Trust me.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]First pickup[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Well that's a relief.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You did the right thing.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I knew you wouldn't leave me behind![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Whew.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I applaud your need for me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'd do the same for you[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Build comments[[/Heading]][[Comment]]This probably belongs to another category, like maybe "Out of combat banter"?[[/Comment]]
[[GameText]]Beware theres a new [second half of build] in town.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"Other weapons attached" complaints[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Using me alongside this [weapon name] isn't good for our relationship.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This [weapon name] is depressing me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hands up! Drop the [weapon name]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm allergic to guns and cannons. I might not be able to hit straight in this state. Really.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you've got this [weapon name], why do you need me, huh?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I suggest removing this [weapon name].[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Why must I share space with this [weapon name]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Do we really need this [weapon name] around? It should just be you and me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You are suspiciously close to your [weapon name].[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm not naming names, but a certain [weapon name(can be gun cannon and melee)] is starting to bug me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]We need to have a talk about your affection for that [weapon name].[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"In inventory complaints/underuse" complaints (start of map)[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]A little more cooperative murder would be good for both of us.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You should use me more often.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"Using other weapons instead" complaints[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]I'm starting to think you like your [melee weapon] more than me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you don't want me around just say so, oh silent one.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hmpf.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you're not going to use me, just drop me and get it over with.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"Detachment" complaints (Companion Sword only)[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Sadness...[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Friends don't sideline friends.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]All the other swords are going to make fun of me now.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This is my sad face.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Fine, just brush me aside like I'm nothing, see where that gets you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Now if you don't mind, I'd like you to do the reverse of what you just did.[[/GameText]] [[Comment]]Got this line from a system corruption rejection.[[/Comment]]

[[Heading:3]]Out of combat banter[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]You're looking dapper there, friend. Don't let anyone else tell you otherwise.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]We make a good team.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Fewer friendlies in the world, too bad.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm feeling especially deadly right now, but don't let that affect your plans, it's just a feeling.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You're pretty cool sometimes.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm really excited about what the future may hold for us.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I need buffs.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Together we are unstoppable![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Does that thing on me look more like a heart, or maybe a broken triangle?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A sword and a robot, best of friends.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Have you heard of something called Tec---[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Expand your utility interfacing capabilities, you should see me with more buffs![[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Normal combat[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Powered by friendship![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Gotta go fast![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You can run but you can't hide![[/GameText]] [[Comment]]This one and the next sound like "enemy moving away" dialogues, are they?[[/Comment]]
[[GameText]]Ooh, playing hard to get?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Well there go our bot shields[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A quantum pathway, in I go![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]it's amazing what we can do when we work together.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This will take no time at all.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Enemy moves backwards during engagement[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Back up all you want, that gives us room to charge![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Looks pretty afraid to me.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]When surprise attacking[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Multipass![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]They can tag team, but so can we! I mean me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Tag team![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Get in line, [bot class].[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Bankai![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Look out beside you![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Do that again![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You look like you want some, too, [bot class]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Surprise![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Watch out beside you![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Boo.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Need a little extra help?[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Disrupt shutdown[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Not so scary now, are you [bot class]?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You can thank me later, let's destroy this tool.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Time-out for you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A moment of silence for [bot class] here.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Core damage[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Sorry about your core, it's for the greater good![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A little extra strain on your core to speed up their death is worth it[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A little core integrity fora lot of quick damage, good trade yeah?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]This might hurt a bit.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Sneak attack[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Don't worry, I got this[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Sneaky, I like it![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]How did we get so sneaky.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Quiet and deadly![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Not easy to dodge what you didn't see coming, eh?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Never saw that coming.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]It's [bot class] hunting season![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Like ninja![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Gotcha, [bot class][[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Your lack of awareness will be your undoing, [bot class]![[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]After normal kill[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Next time stand a little more to the left[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Shhh.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I love the sparks and fizzles.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]One less [bot class] to worry about.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]That [bot class] wont be bothering us anymore.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Does that count for a notch for me or you? or both of us![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]We rock! we also slice and dice![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]That wasn't so hard, was it?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Another one down.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You swing, I cut![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Beautiful work.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I love it when you use me like that.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A respectable final blow.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You point, I kill. Just point straight and everything is good.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Let's chop some more [bot class]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I have an especially strong urge to obliterate every [bot class] we meet.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]They won't even see this draw.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Your contribution is appreciated.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Another one bites the concrete.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Sliced [bot class], my favorite![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Boom.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Good times.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You sure know how to make a sword happy.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Nice one.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I love the feel of scrap metal exploding around me.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Sever[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Oh I'm sorry, is that your [severed item name] on the ground?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Oh sorry, did you need that [severed item name]?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]A clean cut.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Your loss is our salvage[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Attacking walls[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Making shortcuts are we?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm not an axe or hammer, you know.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]What did that [wall] ever do to us?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Do I look like a digging implement?[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Surge of energy[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]He winds up for the hit and...[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]End of the road, [bot class]![[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Follow up attack as secondary weapon[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]I'm disappointed in you, forcing me to attack after that [melee weapon name][[/GameText]] 
[[GameText]]I thought all you needed was me![[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Refusing to follow up attack as secondary melee weapon[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]There's no way I'm following the [melee weapon name] into battle.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Sorry, I attack alone.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]You won't catch me behind that [weapon name].[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Upgrading[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Time to take this relationship to the next level.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Faster, smarter, less swordy and more swordy at the same time...[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]As you get more powerful, it's only fair that I, too, become godlike![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I knew we could do great things together.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Ultimate power! Well there's always room for improvement, but I'm feeling it.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Uncategorized[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Are we going to die?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]My rage meter is topping out already.[[/GameText]] [[Comment]]Got it when getting the "Batter Up!" achievement. Was it because of using a hammer, losing parts, or some other reason?[[/Comment]]
[[GameText]]You should use me on more respectable targets.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]No thanks.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'll sit this one out.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]After our adventure to do whatever you want, let's go on a journey to find out where the heck I came from.[[/GameText]]
[[Comment]]I got the line about finding out the Companion Sword's origins shortly after entering the S7 hangar, so it might be location-specific, but it could just be a coincidence and be regular out-of-combat banter?[[/Comment]]

[[Heading:2]]Quantum Companion or Superquantum Companion only[[/Heading]]

[[Heading:3]]Gaining bot sensor ability[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Whoa man, I suddenly feel like I'm hallucinating.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Destroyed [[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]This is not the end![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I won't judge you if you run like hell and await my return.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you can't beat 'em, die and come back later.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]The power of friendship will sustain me![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]BRB.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]See you soon.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'll be back.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I think I might really die this time! ...Nah.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Death is but one step on a long and eventful journey.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Shadow attack[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]I'm flyyyiiing![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I didn't used to think it was possible to be in two places at once, but there I am[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Fwoosh![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]That [bot class] is eyeing me funny.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Fling me that way... Never mind I'll do it myself.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]And away I go.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Let's see who can close the distance faster![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Teamwork![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I have something I have to do real quick.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]There more of them there are, the madder I get.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Be right back, I have something I need to take care of.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Sunder[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Avert your eyes, this is going to get messy.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Show us your guts, [bot class]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Pinata time![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Today's forecast: Strong attacks with a chance of flying parts.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Time to get naked, [bot class].[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm going to need to borrow a little energy here...[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Redirecting projectile[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Away with you![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Did you see that?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Not this time, evil projectile![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Begone![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I can block 100% of projectiles 5% of the time![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]The best kind of shield is a sword that shields you![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]On your way now.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Not at my friend![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Batter up![[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Teleport[[/Heading]]
[[GameText]]Hi [robot class], may I introduce you to my friend?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hey [robot] class, my friend and I here would like a word with you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Ludicrous speed![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Let's see who can close the distance faster![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Friends don't let friends go into battle alone.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]There is no escape![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I found a quick route to the action![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Look at that [bot class] over there, just asking for a beating.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Anime style![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I can't wait any longer![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Here I come [bot class]![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Let's go, friend[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hello over there![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Let's get this over with, I already know how this encounter ends.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]Rematerializing[[/Heading]] [[Comment]]Some of these lines appear to be related to the Companion rematerializing after dying, while others are from simple detachment.[[/Comment]]
[[GameText]]I've waited long enough.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm back.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Let's go slash some bots.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]If you won't attach me, I will![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Equip me like you mean it.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I'm starting to worry you don't actually like me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hey there.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Friendo![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I missed you.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I know you were about to come get me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]It's stuffy in there![[/GameText]] (from inventory)
[[GameText]]The time is now.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]I came as soon as I thought you were about to call me.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]That was uncalled for.[[/GameText]] (after picked up by a [[Recycler]])
[[GameText]]I'm feeling a little insulted right now.[[/GameText]] (after being picked up by a Recycler)
[[GameText]]How could you do that![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Aand I'm back again.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Ah what new adventures await us this time...[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Wouldn't it be awkward if I came back in the middle of my funeral?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Feels good to be back.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Oh the places I've been, the robots I've seen![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]So how are things with you?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Did you miss me?[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Fancy meeting you here.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Hey I remember you![[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Rumours of my death have been greatly exaggerated.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Best friends always come back.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Do I know you? Just kidding.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading:3]]"About to end current game session" goodbye[[/Heading]]
(Can appear after closing the menu, exact cause unknown) [[Comment]]I've only had these with Quantum/Superquantum, but maybe i just didn't trigger the conditions with the Companion Sword? I got those lines after somewhat long sessions (at least ~30 minutes). Every time, i'd opened the gallery, often to look at one of the Companion's forms. The dialogue appeared once i closed the menu. I'm not sure what the exact conditions are.[[/Comment]]
[[GameText]]Goodbye, friend.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]Goodbye, for now.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]The power of friendship will sustain me![[/GameText]]

Name: Core Reset Matrix
Content:
The Core Reset Matrix, or CRM, is a consumable [[Alien Artifacts]] that provides one of the [[Alignment|alignment]] options in the game. It provides a combination of helpful and unhelpful effects, and as such should often not be used in every game unlike other consumable items.

[[Heading]]Effects[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:3]]Alien Alliance[[/Heading]]
[[Assembled]] and [[Golem|Golems]] will turn from hostile to purple uncontrollable allies. Additionally, if [[Imprint|Imprinted]], [[Redacted]][[Z-Light|Z-Lights]], [[Z-Heavy|Z-Heavies]], and [[Experimental|Experimentals]] summoned from [[Command]] cave seals will turn from purple into blue controllable allies.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]]Alien Artifact Detection[[/Heading]]
After consuming the CRM and when entering a new map, the locations and types of all Alien Artifacts are revealed on the map. The part IDs of all Alien Artifacts are also granted to Cogmind.
[[Heading:3]]Alien Language Understanding[[/Heading]]
Cogmind will be able to understand the speech of the [[Sigix Containment Pod]] when rescued.
[[Redacted]][[Heading:3]]Cave Seal Allies[[/Heading]]
If a Command cave seal is opened and Cogmind is not Imprinted or allied with [[Warlord]], cave seals will initially contain 1 Golem and 10-13 Assembled.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]][[Corruption]] Cleanse[[/Heading]]
Corruption is reset to 0%.
[[Heading:3]]Hypermatrix Pings[[/Heading]]
When Cogmind's core reaches below 33%, Cogmind will emit a hypermatrix ping and 6-8 Assembled will spawn next to Cogmind. This only happens on main [[0b10]] floors and in [[Command]]. After this, Cogmind will be able to detect further hypermatrix pings at a range of 18 tiles of other groups of assembled. Coming within a few tiles of these pings with visual contact will cause a further 6-8 Assembled to pop out.
[[Heading:3]]Memory Reset[[/Heading]]
Cogmind loses all map data, part IDs, [[Robot Analysis|Analyses]], [[Schematic|Schematics]], [[Study|Studies]], [[Data Conduit|Data Conduit intel]], [[RIF]] alliance, [[A7 Data Core|A7 Data Core intel]], and any manual [[Terminal]] or robot hacks. Notably, Cogmind will not lose [[FarCom]] or Imprint.
[[Heading:3]]Non-Alien Hostilities[[/Heading]]
Certain groups will no longer trust Cogmind as a result of using a CRM. If [[Zhirov]] shows up in [[Access]] as a result of completing the [[SGEMP Prototype]] quest, he and his allies will immediately turn hostile to Cogmind. [[Redacted]]The surrender option is no longer offered by [[MAIN.C]], causing the W8 [[Wintypes|Wintype]] to be unobtainable.[[/Redacted]]
[[Redacted]][[Heading:3]][[Sigix Exoskeleton]] Control[[/Heading]]
Cogmind is able to pilot the Exoskeleton located in [[Section 7]].[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]]Unique Wintype[[/Heading]]
Taking a [[Surface]] exit after using a CRM awards the W2 wintype.

[[Heading]]Where to find[[/Heading]]
As an Alien Artifact, the CRM is only found in a few specific places:
[[Gallery]][[Redacted]]Lab CRM.png[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]][[Lab]], guaranteed spawn every game[[/Redacted]]|Quarantine CRM.png|[[Quarantine]], almost every game in unique machinery|[[Redacted]]Section 7 CRM.png[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]]Found in Section 7 unguarded Alien Artifact Suspension Chambers, random chance[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]]Section 7 CRM Cache.png[[/Redacted]]|[[Redacted]]1-3 can be found in the Section 7 LRC cache, random chance[[/Redacted]][[/Gallery]]

Name: Corrupted Parts
Content: Attaching a corrupted part will give you [[Corruption]]. Corrupted parts may be repaired at a Repair Station.

Name: Corruption
Content:
Corruption is a [[Game Mechanics|Gameplay Mechanic]] that can cause numerous negative effects on bots, up to instant death at 100% corruption. Corruption is an always visible stat in the HUD for Cogmind. Other bots can be [[Datajacks|Datajacked]] in order to see their corruption.

[[Heading]]Getting corruption[[/Heading]]
[[List]]Electromagnetic Damage: Between 50-150% of EM damage is also inflicted as corruption for non-Cogmind bots. For Cogmind, each hit has a [damage %] chance of inflicting 1% corruption.|
Impact Damage destroying parts: Each destroyed part inflicts between 25-150% corruption to non-Cogmind bots. For Cogmind, each destroyed part inflicts between 1-5% corruption.|
Getting hit by a Corruption Crit: Between 1-10% of the damage inflicted (including EM resistance but not other forms of damage reduction) is also inflicted as corruption. If the corruption inflicted is less than 0, it truncates to 0 rather than rounding up. For example, 5% of 10 damage would be .5% corruption, which truncates to 0.|
Attaching a [[Corrupted Parts|Corrupted Part]]: Between 1% and [corruption % on death / 10] corruption, capped at 15%.|
Feedback from being fully traced at an [[Interactive Machine]] (1%).[[/List]]
Note: All sources of corruption are affected by EM damage resistance.

[[Heading]]Corruption Effects[[/Heading]]
Some corruption effects can happen at any point in time, some only happen while hostiles are nearby, and some are permanent negative effects unless corruption is purged. Chance based corruption effects become more common at higher corruption.
[[Heading:2]]Cogmind Corruption Effects[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]
Name|Effect|Extra Conditions||
Message Error|Garbled messages appear in the game log.|N/A||
Matter Fused|Loss of between 5-10 [[Matter]], with the log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: Matter fused (-x).[[/GameText]]|Only occurs if Cogmind has > 0 matter||
Heat Flow Error|Large spike in [[Heat]], between 100 and 300, with log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: Heat flow error (+x).[[/GameText]]|N/A||
Energy Discharge|Loss of stored [[Energy]], between 20-40% of current storage capacity, with log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: Energy discharge (-x).[[/GameText]]|Only occurs if Cogmind has > 0 energy||
Part Rejected|A random part is detached, not including fragile parts like processors, with log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: [part name] rejected.[[/GameText]]|Only occurs while hostile bots are nearby||
Part Fused|A random part that isn't fragile or fused already becomes fused and is unable to be detached without destruction, with log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: [part name] fused.[[/GameText]]|N/A||
Data Loss (Minor/Major)|There are two similar effects of data loss. A minor data loss will lose 1-3 component part ID with the log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: Component data lost.[[/GameText]] A major data loss will lose 3-5 component part IDs with the log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: Substantial component data lost.[[/GameText]]|N/A||
Misfire|A random weapon will be attempted to be fired. Fails if the weapon does not have enough resources to fire (matter/energy). This effect doesn't affect melee weapons, special weapons, or guided weapons. Also has the log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: FCS attempts to trigger [part name].[[/GameText]] If the misfire is successful, there is an additional log message [[GameText]]System corrupted: [part name] misfires.[[/GameText]] Similarly to [[Autonomous Weapons]], This does not incur any time cost. Similarly to regular volleys, any heat generated is averaged over the time it would have taken to fire that weapon normally.|N/A||
IFF Burst|An IFF burst comes from Cogmind, alerting hostiles within a 15 tile radius. Bots will head to investigate the location of the IFF burst but do not gain active tracking on Cogmind. Also has the log message [[GameText]]IFF burst signal emitted.[[/GameText]]|N/A||
Misdirection|Cogmind may move in a random direction other than the one commanded, with game popup message (not log message) [[GameText]]System corrupted: Misdirected.[[/GameText]] On flight, may come with an additional penalty of slamming into a wall. If this occurs, Cogmind will take minor impact damage, with the log message [[GameText]]Slammed into [ceiling/wall].[[/GameText]]|Only occurs while hostile bots are nearby||
Weapon Failure|A weapon will fail to fire during a volley. Based on if the weapon is a ballistic weapon, energy weapon, or launcher, the log message will be the following: [[GameText]]System corrupted: [part name] jammed/failed to cycle/failed to launch.[[/GameText]]|Only occurs on firing a volley||
Hacking Penalty|Cogmind suffers a [corruption % / 3] penalty to the success rate of hacks on all interactive machines.|N/A||
Accuracy Penalty|Cogmind suffers a [corruption % / 4]% penalty to accuracy.|N/A||
Allied Trap Triggering|Can trigger allied traps when walking on top of them, with a [corruption %] chance of triggering.|N/A||
Instant Death|When Cogmind hits 100% corruption, the game is instantly over|>100% corruption 
[[/Table]]
[[Heading:2]]Non-Cogmind Corruption Effects[[/Heading]]
[[Table]]
Name|Effect||
Memory Loss|Typically, each action subtracts 1 from a bot's memory memory while it is out of line of sight of a target they are tracking. Bots have an additional penalty applied to their memory that is calculated as [corruption % / 10]. For example, a [[G-34 Mercenary]] at 0% corruption has a memory of 20 actions. At 10% corruption, this is reduced to 10 actions (20 / 2). At 20%, this is reduced to 7 (20 / 3, rounding up).||
Accuracy Penalty|Bots suffers a [corruption % / 8]% penalty to accuracy.||
Misfire|Bots will shoot something that wasn't intentionally aimed at. Unlike Cogmind misfires, this can only occur while a bot is actively shooting and all weapons in one volley will fire at the same target. When a bot shoots a non-bot target, there is a log message [[GameText]][bot name] misfires.[[/GameText]] If another bot is targeted, there is a different log message [[GameText]][bot name] IFF system glitched.[[/GameText]]||
Allied Trap Triggering|Can trigger allied traps when walking on top of them, with a [corruption %] chance of triggering.||
Instant Death|When a non-Cogmind bot hits 100% corruption, they will die at the end of their next turn[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Preventing Corruption[[/Heading]]
[[List]][[Redacted]][[Core Membrane]]: Completely negates all corruption gains[[/Redacted]]|[[Corruption Screens]]: Takes damage to prevent corruption gain|[[Dynamic Insulation Systems]]: Has a chance of negating corruption gain|EM resistance: All sources of corruption are proportionally reduced by EM resistance, and a 100% EM resistant bot cannot gain corruption in any way.|[[System Guards]]: Reduces effective corruption by a certain amount. Does not truly purge it but behaves like it isn't there.[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Purging Corruption[[/Heading]]
[[List]][[Spoiler]][[Core Reset Matrix]]: On attach, corruption is reset to 0[[/Spoiler]]|
Evolving|
[[System Restoration Modules]] active effect|
[[Programmer]] effect to reset corruption (non-Cogmind only)[[/List]]

Name: Corruption Reduction Utilities
Groups: Corruption Screens,Dynamic Insulation Systems,System Guards,System Restoration Modules

Name: Coupling Squad
Content:
[[Image]]Coupling Squad.png|A Programmer installing Relay Couplers into a Garrison[[/Image]]
Coupling squads are [[0b10]] aligned [[Squad|squads]] that are sent to restock [[Garrison Access|Garrison Machines]] with [[Relay Couplers]]. They can appear on any 0b10 floor that contains a Garrison as well as on the inside of [[Garrison|Garrisons]]. They consist of a single [[Programmer]] carrying 3-4 Relay Couplers. The Programmer is 1 tier above typical Programmers for the depth. For example, a typical -7 Programmer is a [[P-60 Hacker]], but a coupling squad will instead be a [[P-70 Sage]].
Coupling squads are dispatched if a Garrison has no Relay Couplers in its builtin inventory. Garrison machines usually contain 3-4 Couplers at all times, but sometimes one will be present on initial map entry with none. Full Garrisons will also lose their inventory over time and become empty. In either case, a Programmer will eventually be called to that Garrison to restock the Couplers. When a coupling squad Programmer reaches its target Garrison, a message like [[GameText]]P-70 Sage installs Relay Coupler [Grunt] into garrison access.[[/GameText]] will appear in the log. After all the couplers are installed, the Programmer will exit through the Garrison.

[[Heading]]Intentional dispatching[[/Heading]]
Coupling squads can also dispatched if Cogmind uses the [[Spoiler]]Trojan(Restock)[[/Spoiler]] hack. If this is done, log text similar to [[GameText]]ALERT: Unscheduled coupler replacement inbound for Garrison vPm.7n.[[/GameText]] will appear after a few turns. A similar restock effect will occur if Cogmind uses the [[Spoiler]]Force(Eject)[[/Spoiler]] hack.

Name: Critical Hits
Content:
Critical hits (crits) are effects that have a chance to trigger on any successful hit. The chance and the specific effect depends on the weapon.

[[Heading]]Critical Effects[[/Heading]]
Each type of critical is generally associated with a given type of weapon. But there are exceptions: weapons that have a different type of critical effect or no critical at all.

[[Table]]
Name|Effect of critical hit|Usual weapon||
Destroy|[[TooltipText]]Destroy[[/TooltipText]]|[[Ballistic Guns]]||
Blast|[[TooltipText]]Blast[[/TooltipText]]|[[Ballistic Cannons]]||
Burn|[[TooltipText]]Burn[[/TooltipText]] (See [[Heat]]).|[[Thermal Guns]]||
Meltdown|[[TooltipText]]Meltdown[[/TooltipText]]|[[Thermal Cannons]]||
Corrupt|[[TooltipText]]Corrupt[[/TooltipText]]|[[Electromagnetic Weapons]]||
Smash|[[TooltipText]]Smash[[/TooltipText]] (See [[Shieldings]]).|[[Impact Weapons]]||
Sever|[[TooltipText]]Sever[[/TooltipText]]|[[Slashing Weapons]], [[Plasma Cutters]]||
Impale|[[TooltipText]]Impale[[/TooltipText]]|[[Piercing Weapons]]||
[[Spoiler]]Detonate[[/Spoiler]]|[[Spoiler]][[TooltipText]]Detonate[[/TooltipText]][[/Spoiler]]|[[Vortex Guns]]||
[[Spoiler]]Sunder[[/Spoiler]]|[[Spoiler]][[TooltipText]]Sunder[[/TooltipText]][[/Spoiler]]|[[Vortex Cannons]], [[Vortex Lance]]||
[[Spoiler]]Intensify[[/Spoiler]]|[[Spoiler]][[TooltipText]]Intensify[[/TooltipText]][[/Spoiler]]|[[Phasers]]||
[[Spoiler]]Phase[[/Spoiler]]|[[Spoiler]][[TooltipText]]Phase[[/TooltipText]][[/Spoiler]]|[[Alpha Cannons]]
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Immunities[[/Heading]]
Some bots have resistances that provide immunity to some criticals or some of their effects:
[[List]]
Coring: [[TooltipText]]Coring[[/TooltipText]]
|Meltdown: [[TooltipText]]Meltdown[[/TooltipText]]
|[[Spoiler]]Criticals[[/Spoiler]]: [[Spoiler]][[TooltipText]]Criticals[[/TooltipText]][[/Spoiler]]
|[[Spoiler]]Dismemberment[[/Spoiler]]: [[Spoiler]][[TooltipText]]Dismemberment[[/TooltipText]][[/Spoiler]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Improving Critical Chance[[/Heading]]
There are several ways to improve critical chance:
[[List]]
Simply using more weapons, which increases the chance that a given volley will include a critical hit.
|Equipping [[Target Analyzers]], which increase each weapon's critical chance, though this does not affect the Meltdown critical or provide critical effects to weapons that do not have them already.
|Using weapons with higher critical chances, such as [[Hypervelocity Weapons]]. (But weapons that specialize in critical hits generally do less raw damage.)[[/List]]

Name: Cryofiber Webs
Content:
[[Heading]]List of Cryofiber Webs[[/Heading]]
[[PartGroupTable]]
Cryofiber Webs|
Overview/Size|
Overview/Rating|
Overview/Integrity|
Overview/Coverage|
Upkeep/Energy|
Effect/Effect
[[/PartGroupTable]]
Parts: Cryofiber Web,Imp. Cryofiber Web,Adv. Cryofiber Web,Exp. Cryofiber Web

Name: Cutter
Content:
Cutters are a [[Bot Groups|Bot Group]] of [[Flight Units|flying]] [[0b10]] combat robots that are most often seen in [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcement Squads]] after being summoned by [[Heavy|Heavies]] against flying or hovering bots. Armed with a Saw and Concussive RPG, these units will firstly fire their single-use RPG at the enemy and overload to try and sever the enemy's parts with their Saw. They will overload as soon as they are alerted to any hostile bot. They are harder to hit due to their small size and [[Reaction Control System|Reaction Control Systems]].
Cutters are a major nuisance at best, and a run ender for an airborne build at worst. Their ability to overload makes outrunning them nearly impossible in the long run, even for flight builds. This is even more challenging when their Saws sever essential parts off of Cogmind's body with a single hit, forcing Cogmind to either give up that part or waste essential turns re-attaching parts. The best strategy to kill them is typically a point blank explosive [[Launchers|Launcher]] to the face, as they have high core exposure and low core integrity. Launchering a nearby wall also helps to work around their high evasion. Explosive machine arrays are especially good at dispatching a group of Cutters since they can't miss. A [[Graphene Brace]] removes their sever capability and can make encounters with them much easier for combat builds.
[[Gallery]]Cutters.png|All Cutter variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]][[Squad|Squads]][[/Heading]]
Cutters may appear in the following squads:
[[List]][[Patrol Squad]] - only in [[Garrison|Garrisons]]|Reinforcement Squad - only from Heavy-summoned Reinforcements.[[/List]]

Name: DRS Beacon
Content: Used to summon a [[DRS Ranger]] rescue squad in [[Caves]] when activated. Rangers will attempt to pathfind to cogmind and follow them until they leave the level.

Name: DRS Ranger
Content: More powerful [[Ranger]] variants that appear in [[Caves]] when a [[DRS Beacon]] is used.

Name: DSF
Content:
DSF (Distributed Storage Facility) is a [[0b10]]-controlled sub-floor in [[Factory]] and [[Research]] branches that appears in all depths from -7 through -2. It can only be entered by hacking open a DSF entrance terminal (base 50% chance) without being spotted by any hostiles on the map. DSFs contain large amounts of non-[[Prototype Part|Prototype]] parts in groups of 2-6 that can be any part that can normally appear on the ground for the given depth. Unlike most maps, the ambient temperature in DSFs is -10 rather than 0. This has the effect of giving an additional 10 heat dissipation per turn to all bots on the map.
The overall map layout is semi-fixed. It consists of 2-4 quadrants connected by 2-tile wide corridors In the corner of each quadrant are large Matter Repository machines that will release [[Matter]] when broken. These corridors can have [[Alarm Trap|Alarm Traps]] and [[Stasis Trap|Stasis Traps]] in them but not in the item stockpiles. The exit will never be in the quadrant that Cogmind starts in. In the center of every DSF is a depth-appropriate [[Heavy]], guarding all of the main corridors in the map. Around the Heavy are 4 unpowered [[A-15 Conveyor|A-15 Conveyors]]. The corners of the map can have individual dormant [[Specialist|Specialists]], but not always. There are sometimes groups of 4 prototypes hidden behind emergency access doors in the center of a quadrant, and these prototypes will typically be out-of-depth. Sometimes there is a [[Sentry]] guarding this prototype stockpile.
[[Lore]]0b10 Records|DSF[[/Lore]]

[[Heading]]Mechanics[[/Heading]]
The Heavy in the center of the map makes nearly the entire map relatively unsafe. Although there are no patrols initially, walking through the DSF will quickly get some standard Heavy [[Reinforcement Squad|Reinforcements]] called on Cogmind. These reinforcements behave no differently than an normal map.
[[Heading:2]]Additional Patrols[[/Heading]]On top of the standard Heavy reinforcements, there are other ways to summon additional patrols. These patrols come in the form of 3 [[C-30 ARC|ARCs]] carrying other bots inside, spaced roughly 80 turns apart. These patrols will come one at a time and remain on the map permanently unless destroyed. These additional patrols can be summoned in one of 3 ways:
[[List]]The Heavy summoning reinforcements: When Cogmind is detected via the Heavy's active scanning, additional patrols will be summoned shortly after.|Terrain destruction: Patrols will be summoned if any of the walls of the DSF are destroyed by any means.|Alarm trap: Patrols will be summoned if an alarm trap is triggered and not jammed using a [[Transmission Jammer]].[[/List]]
[[Heading:2]]Rapid Sterilization[[/Heading]]
After killing around 10 hostiles on the map, rapid sterilization will be engaged. 20 turns after this announcement the ambient heat will rise by 10 and continue to raise by another 10 every 15 turns. This will happen until Cogmind exits the map. This also enables the [[Encrypted Comm Array]] to spawn in the next [[Caves]] if Cogmind does not have a conflicting faction.

[[Heading]]Events[[/Heading]]
[[Gallery]]DSF Derelict Assault 1.png|A Derelict assault on a DSF|DSF Derelict Assault 2.png|A massive Derelict vs 0b10 fight in a DSF|DSF Assembled.png|Assembled infesting a DSF|DSF Wild Derelict Assault.png|Wild Derelicts attacking a DSF[[/Gallery]]
[[List]](++) Derelict assault group on entry: A group of [[Derelict|Derelicts]] are present on entering the map next to Cogmind. These bots will charge the center of the map, try to kill the heavy, and continue on toward the exit. If any Derelicts survive, they will continue through the exit and show up on the next map.|(++) Derelict assault enters after Cogmind: Similar to the previous event, bots will trickle one at a time onto the map and then wander around the map instead of heading directly toward the exit.|(++) Derelict assault in progress: A much larger Derelict attack force fights a large number of 0b10 bots. This can include prototype 0b10 and Warlord bots, such as [[Striker|Strikers]] and [[Hydra|Hydras]].|(~) Sapper sabotage: 2 [[Sapper|Sappers]] will appear at the start of the map with lots of [[Sapper Charge|Sapper Charges]] on the ground. Large explosions will follow the 2 bots through the map as they head for the exit. For slower propulsion types, do not slow down or else the high damage explosions will reach you.|(~) [[Assembled (4)|Assembled]] infestation: Assembled will appear behind the emergency access doors with a cache of prototype items and roam around the map. They will continue to spawn in greater waves and attack everything in sight. Up to two [[Demolisher]] response squads will be summoned to deal with them.|(~) Wild Derelict Assault: Wild (and hostile) cave Derelicts will attack the DSF from the exit and roam around the map. They will attack 0b10 and Cogmind-allied bots alike.[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Exits[[/Heading]]
There is only one exit in each DSF. Most of the time the exit leads to the next main floor, although it can occasionally lead into a [[Garrison]] on the current depth. If leading to a Garrison, the Garrison exit will not loop back to the same depth again.

Name: DW-4LL
Content:
DW-4LL is a part of the deadly group of [[Unchained]] [[Derelict|Derelicts]] that work for [[0b10]] to track down threats to the complex. It wields one of two signature shotguns, either [[DW-4LL's Slamshotty]] or [[DW-4LL's Megashotty]]. Both of these guns deal very large amounts of short to medium-ranged impact damage. These weapons, coupled with DW-4LL's [[Exp. Weapon Cycler]] and [[Exp. Armor Integrity Analyzer]], will quickly shred any low integrity parts on any bot it attacks. Defensively, 200 core integrity at 15% exposure and an impressively high 2800 damage armor in [[DW-4LL's Blast Wall]] make it hard to take down. DW-4LL also gets around very quickly for a treaded bot with their 70 speed [[DW-4LL's Griptreads]].

[[Heading]]Lore[[/Heading]]
[[Lore]]Cyclists Records|UC/DW-4LL[[/Lore]]

[[Heading:2]][[FarCom]] Lore[[/Heading]]
If Cogmind has aligned with the [[Exiles (Group)|Exiles]] and has FarCom, the following message will be broadcast about DW-4LL:
[[GameText]]This is a tough one, they are really good at hiding in the walls and will wait for you to get close before springing an attack. I guess you can use a [[Structural Scanner]] to help prevent being caught completely by surprise.[[/GameText]]

[[Heading]]Behavior[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]DW-4LL Disguise.png|DW-4LL revealed with a Structural Scanner[[/Image]]
DW-4LL is an ambusher that will lie in wait inside a wall nearby and burst out before attacking. If a [[Structural Scanner]] is attached, a log message [[GameText]]Structural anomaly detected.[[/GameText]] will appear and a nearby tile will start flashing red a few turns before DW-4LL reveals itself. Once revealed, DW-4LL will continue fighting until reaching roughly 50% core health. At that point, it will try to retreat to the nearest [[Garrison Access]], although it will stop occasionally to take a few shots while running away if Cogmind pursues. If it makes it to a Garrison after retreating, it will appear in a wall again in a few hundred turns, fully repaired.

[[Heading]]Strategy[[/Heading]]
Dealing an average of 66 or 71 damage per turn (with the Slamshotty and Megashotty respectively), this Unchained puts out an incredible amount of impact damage spread across all of Cogmind's parts at once. If you are forced to get into a head-on fight, make sure to preemptively remove all low-integrity parts. It is also often worth ripping off Processors upon announcement since they are highly likely to be destroyed anyway.
The best way to prepare for DW-4LL is to use a lot of high integrity parts to soak up the damage. [[Treads]], [[Armor]], and [[Ballistic Cannons]] are good examples of parts that can take the punishment. [[Shield Generators]] and [[Force Fields]] are, as always, great options to cut the damage down. However, thanks to DW-4LL's massive damage output, these parts are unlikely to be sustainable for more than a few turns at a time without massive energy generation.
Defensively, DW-4LL doesn't have any particular weaknesses. Builtin 90% EM resistance makes corruption death fairly difficult. 75% explosive resistance comes from the Blast Wall that is never going to die before DW-4LL does, so [[Explosive Launchers]] are out of the question. Other than that, all damage types are reasonable to use. For offensive utilities, [[Armor Integrity Analyzers]] and [[Core Analyzers]] are generally great options at hitting through the massive coverage of the Blast Wall. However, they tend to fall victim to impact damage due to their low integrity. If you can keep them alive a while with Force Fields, they do make a significant difference in time to kill.
Due to the short range of both possible shotguns, DW-4LL is very vulnerable to being kited by a faster hover or flight build. Any weapon can work for this, though longer-ranged weapons are ideal. [[Hypervelocity Weapons]] are very effective at destroying DW-4LL's Griptreads, rendering it immobile. Once immobile, you can take DW-4LL down at your leisure with any weapon.

Name: Data Conduit
Content:
The machine in [[Data Miner (Location)]] that is the source of the [[Data Miner|Data Miner's]] information. Can be used if the Data Miner is knocked out of the way.

[[Heading]]Rewards[[/Heading]]
[[List]]All obtainable analyses in the game|
Most [[0b10]] [[Prototype Part|Prototype]] IDs, with a notable exception of parts found in [[Protoforge]]|
All interactive and non-interactive machine intel on 0b10 maps|
[[Redacted]]The ability to decrypt the [[Lab]] Terminal and see the Lab scanner tiles[[/Redacted]]|
[[Redacted]]Manual bot hacking [[Datajacks|Datajack]] codes that can be used to destroy all "A" bots on sight[[/Redacted]][[/List]]

[[Heading]]Downsides[[/Heading]]
[[List]][[Intercept Squad|Intercepts]] will be dispatched on most 0b10-controlled floors|
No more [[Enhanced Grunt]] backup when turning [[Warlord]] hostile on the [[Warlord (Alignment)#-2 Research Assault|-2 Research assault]]|
[[God Mode]]'s on-death EMP will inflict massive corruption on Cogmind during the -2 Research assault|
Trying to perform the God Mode hack during the -2 Research Assault will instead instantly detonate God Mode's EMP, also inflicting corruption on Cogmind|
The group of disabled [[Grunt|Grunts]] in [[Armory]] will turn hostile rather than friendly when awakened|
[[Redacted]][[Enhanced Programmer|Enhanced Programmers]] will appear in [[Access_0]][[/Redacted]][[/List]]
The upsides are quite strong but the downsides are very deadly to all but the most prepared Cogmind. [[Tracker|Trackers]] can easily chew up any airborne build with their deadly [[Immobilizer]] to halt any chance of escape with their highly accurate [[Linked Autogun]] to put out the damage. Adequately prepared combat builds can usually dispatch the Trackers without too much trouble and use salvaged Linked Autoguns to great effect. Each Tracker will also summon a [[Combat Programmer]] which is a high-damaging foe that will quickly rack up corruption. Unlike [[Extermination Squad|Exterminations]], Intercepts are move-based and not time-based and tends to punish airborne builds relatively more than combat builds. When using the Data Conduit, Cogmind should either be prepared to exit maps quickly to avoid Intercept encounters or have a plan to fight.

Name: Data Core
Content: Can be obtained by destroying a 0b10 [[Operator]] whose terminal is still active. Reveals nearby [[Traps|Trap]] arrays if collected before its renewal time expires (40 turns). Additionally improves the chances of one hacking attempt for its associated [[Terminal]] if used before its renewal time expires (40 turns), by multiplying the base success rate of direct and indirect hacks by 1.5 if the base success rate is positive, or raising it to 0% if it was negative.

Name: Data Miner (Location)
Content:
The Data Miner location is a [[Caves]] [[Branch]] that appears on either -7 or -6 and is home to the eponymous bot the [[Data Miner]] aka DM. There are no initially hostile bots, but if Data Miner is attacked, the Data Conduit machine is broken, or Cogmind installs a trap, he will trigger a trap door to leave the map and 4 dormant [[Enhanced Grunt|Enhanced Grunts]] hidden in the walls will wake up and become hostile. If you have any [[Corruption]], make sure to detach all ranged weapons to avoid accidental misfires.
There are 4 unique Terminals on the bottom side of the map. The left 2 contain mostly lore records, although the top-left Terminal will also list the depth of [[Section 7]] as well as the access code to the [[Warlord (Location)|Warlord]] Prototype Stash. These two vary per run so make sure to grab these lore entries every time. The bottom ones do not contain any additional information each run. The top-right Terminal will contain several random bot [[Schematic|Schematics]] and the bottom-right Terminal will contain a large number of part schematics and a few Prototype ID Banks. The part schematics will always contain schematics for [[Combat Drone Bay]] and [[Lgt. Regenerative Plating]].

[[Heading]]Alignment[[/Heading]]
Talking with the Data Miner will result in a permanent alignment bonus that does not have any incompatibilities. [[Investigation Squad|Investigations]] and [[Assault Squad|Assaults]] on all [[0b10]]-controlled floors have a 50% chance to be redirected to another random place on the map if Cogmind is determined as needing assistance. For Assaults, this will result in their permanent repositioning. This is a benefit most of the time, although on cramped maps it can be a downside because bots can be grouped together at chokepoints. However, this effect can only occur if Cogmind's build is in a generally poor state. Additionally, several door terminals will automatically open with the Log message [[GameText]]Door Terminal flashes as you approach.[[/GameText]] This will happen at all of the locked cells in [[Extension]] as well as locked entrance Terminal prefabs to Extension, [[Quarantine]], and all 3 [[Command]] entrance Terminals.
[[Heading:2]][[Data Conduit]][[/Heading]]
There is a second secret alignment to this map. After the Data Miner is attacked and either destroyed or trap-doored off the map it is possible to step into and use his Data Conduit machine. Doing so will provide many benefits and some major penalties. Most notably, it provides most analyses and prototype IDs in the game but begins to trigger [[Intercept Squad|Intercepts]] in most 0b10 maps. See the Data Conduit page for full details.

[[Heading]]Fighting[[/Heading]]
Killing the Data Miner himself is highly luck based with only a few ways to improve the chances. A successful Data Miner kill can yield up to 4 pieces of Prototype Hackware at an early depth. Ranged weapons are almost entirely out of the question because he will escape after the first weapon in a volley. However, melee weapon follow-ups will not cause the trap door to activate in between the volley. The primary ways to increase kill chance are to:
[[List]]Use as many weapon slots with melee weapons as possible|Use [[Actuator Arrays]] to increase followup chance|Use [[Core Analyzers]] to increase core hit chance|Use [[Momentum]] to increase damage|Use [[Force Boosters]] to increase damage[[/List]]
[[Heading:2]][[Enhanced Grunt|Enhanced Grunts]][[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Data Miner Combat Dig.png|Digging through the Data Conduit to fight Grunts[[/Image]]
After the Data Miner is attacked these grunts hidden in the wall will burst out and become aggressive. These Grunts have some nice loot for the depth, particularly their [[Neutron Cannon]], [[Adv. Energy Well]], [[Adv. Particle Charger]], and [[Enh. Flexi-carbon Leg|Enh. Flexi-carbon Legs]]. There are several good ways to dispatch these Grunts:
[[Image]]Data Miner Escape Dig.png|Digging through the Data Conduit to escape[[/Image]]
[[List]]Use 2 or more [[Launchers]] and fight them all at once. Explosive launchers will be slower and provide little to no loot but can have a nice range advantage over the Grunts' below average 14 range. EM launchers have a smaller range but will provide a decent amount of loot, although it will be [[Corrupted Parts|Corrupted]].|Dig a tunnel deep into the Data Conduit machine and hide out inside. The Grunts will spread out over time and you can lure them in to fight 1-on-1. This approach works best with some kind of [[Transmission Jammers|Transmission Jammer]] to avoid drawing more than one Grunt at a time. This is the best tactic to fight Grunts with melee or conventional non-launcher methods.[[/List]]
Another approach is to simply run from the Grunts. This works best for airborne builds as they can get in and out with the fewest number of shots. Digging a tunnel through the Data Conduit machine is also very helpful for escaping. Luring the Grunts into a tunnel as you escape out the other end can avoid most attacks. Flight can hop over the grouped-up Grunts and dodge into the spawn areas to avoid more shots

Name: Datajacks
Content:
Datajacks are used for robot hacking, which provides some rudimentary capabilities, and many more with [[RIF]] and an appropriate [[Relay Couplers|Relay Coupler]].

[[Melee Datajacks]] can hack a robot within melee range. [[Remote Datajacks]] can hack a robot at a greater distance. Melee datajacks have advantages to compensate for their reduced range:
[[List]]
If a melee datajack is active, moving into a known hostile trap will attempt to disarm or reprogram it. Remote datajacks do not have a similar capability.
|[[Programmer|Programmers]] can defend their allies against remote datajacks, but not melee datajacks.
[[/List]]

Content: Deploys [[Decoy Drone|Decoy Drones]].
