Name: U-05 Engineer
Content:
A wheeled non-combat robot that repairs any broken walls, doors, or machines in sight. Good source of structural and terrain scanners. When attacked while repairing, calls reinforcements (unless you're in [[Materials]]) 
[[GameText]]ALERT: Construction progress impeded, dispatching reinforcements to local area.[[/GameText]]

Name: Unchained
Content:
Unchained are a collection of powerful and unique [[Derelict|Derelicts]] that have defected to [[0b10]]. As a group, they have vastly different loadouts and behavior, but all are major threats to Cogmind. Unchained are not found on any particular floor, but instead can show up in many different places once Cogmind has caused enough mayhem in some way to trigger a dispatch. Only one of them is ever active at a single time, and the Unchained chosen to be authorized is random. Unlike all other bots in the game, Unchained will actively pursue Cogmind through multiple maps.

[[Heading]]Lore[[/Heading]]
[[Lore]]Cyclists Records|UC Origins[[/Lore]]
[[Gallery]]Unchained.png|All Unchained[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading:2]][[Exiles (Group)|Exiles]] Lore[[/Heading]]
If Cogmind has aligned with the Exiles with [[FarCom]], the Exiles will deliver a message about each Unchained as they are authorized. This is prefaced with the following messages:
[[GameText]]FARCOM_MSG: We kinda like the data you're collecting and don't want to witness your untimely demise, so we kindly advice you to run like hell.[[/GameText]]
[[GameText]]FARCOM_MSG: I've located an exit near your position you could probably use to shake them for a while.[[/GameText]] After this, the nearest exit is revealed.
[[GameText]]FARCOM_MSG: EX-HEX means well, but I for one want to see you stick around and beat the bolts out of [Unchained bot name][[/GameText]]

[[Heading]]Dispatch Triggers[[/Heading]]
There are a large number of triggers which can cause Unchained to be authorized, only some of which are currently known.
[[List]]
[[Sterilization]]: Sterilizing any 0b10 map in [[Factory]] depth (-7) or higher.|
[[Hub_04(d)]] 404: Blowing up all 4 Network Hubs in Hub.|
Too long on map: Spending too many turns on 0b10 maps (how this is calculated is unknown)|
Hacking: Either accessing or performing too many hacks at [[Interactive Machine|Interactive Machines]].|
Interrupting [[Cargo Convoy|Cargo Convoys]]: Interrupting too many Cargo Convoys.|
Killing unique NPCs: This includes named Derelicts such as the [[Exiles (Group)]].|
[[Redacted]]Looting [[Protoforge]][[/Redacted]]: Taking too many parts from Protoforge.
[[/List]]
In addition to the above specific triggers, there is a general requirement for Cogmind to have a "good enough" build. A build that is falling apart is not a sufficient threat to result in an Unchained dispatch even if one of the triggers has been met.
When an Unchained has been decided to be authorized, an announcement like [[GameText]]ALERT: Unchained [Unchained] authorized to operate in [-Depth/Map], avoid or assist as necessary.[[/GameText]] will appear in the game log. The Unchained will not appear until a few hundred turns after the announcement. Initially, Unchained will only be authorized on 0b10-controlled maps. However, some Unchained can continue to follow Cogmind into [[Caves]].

[[Heading]]Behavior[[/Heading]]
Unchained have special behavior that allows them to follow Cogmind between multiple maps, so escape is not as easy as making it to the nearest exit. They take a few hundred turns after entering the map to show up, but once they appear, they will relentlessly pursue Cogmind with [[Perfect Tracking]]. Thanks to this tracking, a [[Triangulator]] may be used to help locate them from a distance before arrival.
Each Unchained has different specific behavior, but all have a tendency to harass Cogmind throughout the floor. Some bots ([[GL-D0S]] and [[QV-33N]]) avoid direct engagement altogether, instead making use of combat-capable allies. Others ([[6S-H0T]], [[DW-4LL]], and [[CL-0N3]]) instead rely on ambushes and general hit-and-run tactics. All Unchained are capable of fleeing into [[Garrison Access|Garrisons]] and through 0b10-controlled exits. Hit-and-run types can run to a Garrison and emerge later, ready to harass Cogmind again.

[[Table]]
Unchained|Engagement Style|Summons allies|Multiple returns per map||
6S-H0T|Hit-and-run|No|Yes, with full repair||
CL-0N3|Ambush|No|Yes, but with no core repair||
DW-4LL|Ambush|No|Yes, with full repair||
GL-D0S|Avoid|Yes|No||
QV-33N|Avoid|Yes|No
[[/Table]]

[[Heading:2]]Map Activity[[/Heading]]
Unchained can only be authorized on 0b10-controlled maps, although they can follow into non-0b10 controlled maps. Typically, Unchained will pursue Cogmind through 3 potential maps before giving up chase. Some Unchained have spawn restrictions which make them not appear on all maps that are Unchained-viable. For example, GL-D0S and QV-33N will not appear in Caves, so taking an exit here will result in a few more maps of freedom. However, once returning to the main complex, they will continue to hunt Cogmind. Possible map dispatches are as follows:
[[Table]]
Map|Original dispatch possible|Continued pursuit||
Main floors ([[Materials]], [[Factory]], [[Research]], [[Access]]|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
[[Mines]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Exiles (Location)]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Subcaves]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[DSF]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Garrison]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Wastes]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Storage]]|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
[[Recycling]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Scraptown]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Caves]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
Caves end branches ([[Data Miner (Location)|Data Miner]], [[Warlord (Location)|Warlord]], [[Zhirov (Location)|Zhirov]], [[Zion]])|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Extension]]|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
[[Cetus]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Archives]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Hub_04(d)]]|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
[[Armory]]|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
[[Lab]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Quarantine]]|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
[[Testing]]|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes|[[CellStyle:Good]]Yes||
[[Protoforge]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Section 7]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Command]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No||
[[Access_0]]|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No|[[CellStyle:Bad]]No
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Unique Drops[[/Heading]]
In addition to normal salvage-based drops, each Unchained may also drop one of two special parts when destroyed. This can be either an [[ID Mask]] or a [[Zeronet Interface]].

Name: United Federation of Derelicts
Content:
The United Federation of Derelicts (UFD) is a major faction of [[Derelict|Derelicts]] that live in [[Scraptown]]. Cogmind can [[Alignment|align]] with the UFD become a member by entering Scraptown through [[Recycling]]. This alignment provides further access into Scraptown along with a few special hacks.
[[Image]]Scraptown Alignment Derelict.png|[[Scrapper (3)]] in Scraptown that gives Cogmind the option to align[[/Image]]

[[Heading]]Further Scraptown Access[[/Heading]]
When Cogmind becomes a member of the UFD, the UFD HQ wall rises up on the map, and a few new areas open up with unique items and bot hacks available as possible benefits. See [[Scraptown#Possible right-side rooms|this page]] for additional details.

[[Heading]][[Optimus]] Alignment[[/Heading]]
After registering as a UFD member, there is an additional option to align 0bPrime for an additional hack, lore, and a lategame event in [[Protoforge]]. Aligning can be done by talking to Optimus in the HQ center area. This will add an additional + to the UFD name in the UI. Aligning will cause a civil war to break out if Cogmind hangs around the map too long, which can be used to grab some loot on the map. However, if Optimus dies in the war, Cogmind's UFD membership is revoked.

[[Heading]]Unique Hacks[[/Heading]]
Several new hacks become available with UFD alignment at [[Recycling Unit|Recycling Units]]:
[[Heading:2]][[GameText]]Force(Fedlink)[[/GameText]][[/Heading]]
This hack hooks up additional Recycling Units to the UFD network. This provides a few more resources to be used for [[Scrapoid]] and [[Scraphulk]] summoning. [[Redacted]]Added resources provide additional support to the UFD during the [[Protoforge]] assault.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:3]]Resource Mechanics[[/Heading]]
The UFD resource count is a number that is indicated in the terminal after each UFD hack is performed. These resources go up automatically on each floor but are more substantially affected by performing Fedlink hacks. Each Fedlink provides +10 resources on the first hack of each depth, +4 resources on the second, and +2 on all subsequent hacks.
The initial resource count is 20 (plus an additional 4 upon entering -6) if Scraptown is located on -9 or -8. This number is bumped up to 35 (plus an additional 3 upon entering -5) if Scraptown is located on -7 to compensate for the extra skipped Factory floor.
Each depth, the number of resources goes up by a small amount:
[[Table]]
Depth|Resources added|Cumulative free resources||
-6|+4|4||
-5|+3|7||
-4|+3|10||
-3|+3|13||
-2|+2|15||
-1|+2|17
[[/Table]]
[[Heading:4]]0bPrime Readiness[[/Heading]]
The numeric resource count is assigned a readiness value based on whether the civil war occurred in Scraptown:
[[Table]]
Readiness|Civil War Range|No Civil War Range||
Minimal|0-79|0-39||
Very Low|80-99|40-59||
Low|100-119|60-79||
Adequate|120+|80-99||
High|N/A|100-119||
Maximal|N/A|120+
[[/Table]]
For full details of what the readiness values indicate, see [[Protoforge#ufd_reinforcements|Protoforge UFD Reinforcements]].
[[Heading:4]]Example Numbers[[/Heading]]
Here are example numbers of a run with Scraptown on -9/-8 with 2 fedlinks performed per depth:
[[Table]]
Depth|Initial Resources|Ending Resources||
-6|24|38||
-5|41|55||
-4|58|72||
-3|75|89||
-2|91|103
[[/Table]]
In order to hit the maximum readiness by -2, 9 additional Fedlinks need to be performed outside of those 2 Fedlinks per depth, assuming no hacks that consume resources are used. To achieve it by -3, that number goes up to 16 additional Fedlinks.
[[Heading:2]][[GameText]]Force(Scraphulk)[[/GameText]][[/Heading]]
This hack summons 1 blue controllable Scraphulk to the Recycling unit within a few turns of performing the hack. Each hack consumes 5 resources from the pool, and it cannot be used without aligning to Optimus and installing 6 Fedlinks first. The Scraphulk summoned depends on the depth.
[[Table]]
Depth|Scraphulk||
-6 to -4|[[Scraphulk (6)]]||
-3 to -1|[[Scraphulk (8)]]
[[/Table]]
[[Heading:2]][[GameText]]Force(Scrapoids)[[/GameText]][[/Heading]]
This hack summons 5 blue controllable depth-dependent Scrapoids to the Recycling unit within a few turns of performing the hack. Each hack consumes 3 resources from the pool. The Scrapoids summoned depends on the depth.
[[Table]]
Depth|Scrapoid||
-6|[[Scrapoid (3)]]||
-5 to -4|[[Scrapoid (6)]]||
-3 to -1|[[Scrapoid (8)]]
[[/Table]]

[[Heading]]Alignment Incompatibilities[[/Heading]]
[[Heading:2]]Blocking Alignment[[/Heading]]
The following will prevent Cogmind from being able to align with UFD in the first place:
[[List]][[RIF]] alignment: The UFD will believe Cogmind to be an unaware spy|[[FarCom]], hostilities in the [[Exiles (Location)|Exiles map]], or stealing an empty [[SUBCON Basin]] from the Scraplab in Recycling: Scraplab researchers will say that Cogmind cannot be trusted[[/List]]
[[Heading:2]]Blocked Alignment[[/Heading]]
Several factions will no longer assist Cogmind after UFD alignment:
[[List]][[Imprint]]: The [[Imprinter]] will say that the Imprinting machine requires a more thorough vetting process for a UFD member such as Cogmind|[[Warlord (Alignment)]]: [[Warlord]] will call Cogmind a spy and not perform the -2 [[Research]] invasion[[/List]]

Name: V-Series
Content:
V-Series are [[Prototype Robot|Prototype Robots]] that exclusively show up in [[Protoforge]]. All V-Series are [[Hover Unit|hovering]], but this is about the only thing that they have in common. Each V-Series has a completely randomized loadout that can be made up of a large number of possible [[Prototype Part|Prototype Parts]]. In this regard, they are similar to [[Q-Series]], though they are much, much stronger.

[[Heading]]Instability[[/Heading]]
One distinguishing point about V-Series is that they are very unstable. About 1/3 of V-Series will explode into a burst of a small amount of EM damage. When this happens, the log message [[GameText]][V-Series name] suddenly sparks and explodes in a catastrophic instability.[[/GameText]] will appear. If a V-Series dies in this way, no parts will be dropped as salvage. This effect will always happen within 50 turns of becoming active.

[[Heading]]Loadouts[[/Heading]]

[[Heading:2]]Power[[/Heading]]
V-Series will have 0-1 power from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Cep. Zero-point Core]]|
[[Hyb. Graviton Reactor]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:2]]Propulsion[[/Heading]]
3-4 slots of propulsion chosen randomly from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Cep. Combat Aerolev Unit]]|
[[Cep. Gyrokinetic System]]|
[[Exp. Antigrav System]]|
[[Gravjet Array]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:2]]Utilities[[/Heading]]
V-Series have multiple utilities that are randomly chosen in the following subcategories. Note: Many utilities are specific to a certain kind of weapon type, such as melee. Utilities are only chosen if they would be compatible with the types of weapons used by the specific V-Series. For example, a melee V-Series would not be given an [[Exp. Weapon Cycler]].
V-Series have 10 available utility slots. Currently, they can actually go above the maximum 10 utility cap. However, they are not guaranteed to always have all 10 slots filled.

[[Heading:3]]Cooling[[/Heading]]
0-2 cooling utility from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Cep. Phasing Heat Sink]]|
[[Cep. Turbovents]]|
[[Exp. Coolant Injector]]|
[[Exp. Cooling System]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Resource Storage[[/Heading]]
0-2 resource storage utilities from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Cep. Chromion Battery]]|
[[Cep. NT7 Matterbank]]|
[[Exp. Energy Well]]|
[[Exp. Matter Compressor]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Vision[[/Heading]]
0-1 from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Exp. Optical Array]]|
[[Spectral Analyzer]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Mass Support[[/Heading]]

0-1 mass support utilities from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Adv. Quantum Shading Machine]]|
[[Quantum Shading Machine]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Targeting[[/Heading]]
0-2 targeting utilities from the following list:
[[List]][[Cep. Countertargeting System]]|
[[Cep. Hypertargeting System]]|
[[Cep. Recoil Nullifier]]|
[[Exp. Launcher Guidance Computer]]|
[[Exp. Melee Analysis Suite]]|
[[Exp. Targeting Computer]]|
[[Weapon Mount]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Energy/Matter Filters[[/Heading]]
0-1 filters from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Prc. Energy Filter]]|
[[Prc. Matter Filter]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Tractor Beams[[/Heading]]
0-1 tractor beams from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Cep. Matter Streamer]]|
[[Lrn. Tractor Beam]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Weapon Cycling Utilities[[/Heading]]
0-1 weapon cycling utilities from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Exp. Weapon Cycler]]|
[[Femtoactuators]]|
[[Launcher Loader]]|
[[Mni. Quantum Capacitor]]|
[[Quantum Capacitor]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Damage Boosting Utilities[[/Heading]]
0-1 damage-boosting utilities from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Adv. Force Booster]]|
[[Adv. Particle Accelerator]]|
[[Exp. Kinecellerator]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Other offensive utilities[[/Heading]]
0-1 offensive utilities from the following list
[[List]]
[[Cep. Melee Reflex Suite]]|
[[Exp. Actuator Array]]|
[[Exp. Armor Integrity Analyzer]]|
[[Exp. Core Analyzer]]|
[[Exp. Target Analyzer]][[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Corruption Resistance Utilities[[/Heading]]

[[List]]

[[Exp. EM Disruption Field]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Resistance Utilities[[/Heading]]

[[Exp. Focal Shield]]|
[[Exp. Shock Absorption System]]|
[[Exp. Thermal Defense Suite]]|
[[Thermal Barrier]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Other Defensive Utilities[[/Heading]]
0-2 other defensive utilities from the following list:
[[List]]
[[Adv. Force Field]]|
[[Cep. Antimissile System]]|
[[Cep. Projectile Intercept Suite]]|
[[Exp. Reaction Control System]]|
[[Exp. Shield Generator]]|
[[Graphene Brace]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Armor[[/Heading]]
2-4 slots of armor from the following list:
[[List]]

[[Centrium Heavy Armor Plating]]|
[[Centrium Medium Armor Plating]]|
[[Cep. Core Shell]]|
[[Cep. RG22 Armor]]|

[[Exp. Weapon Shielding]]|
[[Imp. Powered Armor]]|
[[Lyr. Heavy Armor Plating]]|
[[Lyr. Medium Armor Plating]]|
[[Med. Insulated Plating]]|
[[Med. Reactive Plating]]|
[[Med. Reflective Plating]]|
[[Med. Regenerative Plating]]
[[/List]]

[[Heading:3]]Swarm Drone Bay[[/Heading]]
V-Series may have a [[Swarm Drone Bay]].

[[Heading:2]]Weapons[[/Heading]]
V-Series can have multiple sets of weapon loadouts chosen between various weapon subcategories. Weapons are only assigned if they can be used in conjunction with other weapons and associated utilities. For example, a V-Series will not have both a melee and ranged weapon, nor will it have multiple weapons if it has a Mni. Quantum Capacitor.
[[Heading:3]]Weapon Slots[[/Heading]]
V-Series have one of the following combination of weapon slot counts:
[[List]]
Cannons only: 1-4 slots, but only 1-2 cannons. Note, if a [[Quantum Capacitor|regular]] or [[Mni. Quantum Capacitor]] is attached, only 1 energy cannon will be present.|

Guns only: 3-4 slots.|

Name: VL-GR5
Content: Appears at the entrance of [[Spoiler]][[Armory]][[/Spoiler]]. Challenges [[Cogmind]] to get to 15 kills first, providing [[Spoiler]][[VL-GR5's Timing Chip]][[/Spoiler]] as a reward. After the competition, he will head to the exit on the left side of [[Spoiler]]Armory[[/Spoiler]], dropping the [[Spoiler]][[Multinova Projection Cannon]][[/Spoiler]] if he survives and exits the map. Hitting [[VL-GR5]] a few times will turn him hostile, causing him to shed 2 [[Enh. Nova Cannon|Enh. Nova Cannons]] and attach the [[Spoiler]]Multinova Projection Cannon[[/Spoiler]].

Name: Wardrone Bay
Content: Deploys [[Wardrone|Wardrones]].

Name: Warlord (Alignment)
Content:
Aligning with [[Warlord]] is one of the major faction [[Alignment|alignments]] available to Cogmind in a run and can be done in his [[Warlord (Location)|Base]] in either -5 or -4 [[Upper Caves]]. Aligning with Warlord has effects on 2 major events later in the game. It triggers an event where Warlord, [[God Mode]], and friendly [[Derelict|Derelicts]] assault -2 [[Research]]. It also has a lategame effect in [[Command]]: [[Redacted]]When opening the Command seals, [[Warlord (Command)]] will appear along with a group of other friendly Derelicts.[[/Redacted]]
One Warlord alignment-related item is the [[Encrypted Comm Array]]. If Cogmind either compromises [[Garrison|Garrison]] or [[Sterilization|sterilizes]] [[DSF|DSFs]], Cogmind can receive the Comm Array and learn the depth of Warlord's base. If enough assistance is provided, a force multiplier can provide allies during the -2 assault and in the [[Redacted]]Command Seals[[/Redacted]]. After seeing Warlord in his base, the Comm Array is no longer of any use.

[[Heading]]Restrictions[[/Heading]]
Cogmind cannot align with Warlord in the following scenarios:
[[List]][[RIF]] is installed - The base will be hostile to Cogmind upon entering the base|Attacking [[Scraptown]] - The base will be hostile to Cogmind upon entry|[[Imprint]] - Warlord will be disappointed in Cogmind|[[UFD]] - Warlord will think Cogmind is a spy[[/List]]

[[Heading]]-2 Research Assault[[/Heading]]
The event will begin with the alert [[GameText]]ALERT: Engineering response network critical failure, offline[[/GameText]]. More announcements will show up, but the next most important one will be [[GameText]]Warlord currently on norther/central/southern western approach. All units hit designated targets[[/GameText]] which indicates where Warlord and [[God Mode]] will appear on the map. 50 turns after entering the map, another announcement [[GameText]]Trap arrays successfully disabled[[/GameText]] will come with all traps being removed from the map. 110 after entering the maps, [[GameText]]Machine network successfully disabled[[/GameText]] will indicate that every machine on the map is now shut down except for [[Garrison Access|Garrisons]] due to the follow-up message [[GameText]]Unrecognized interference restored Garrison access controls. Oops. Just blast them.[[/GameText]] 250 turns after entering the map and every 150 turns after that, 3 different assault squad spawns will appear from Garrisons and map exits with the message [[GameText]]Unaware assault squad dispatched in northeast/southeast/southwest/northwest quadrant.[[/GameText]] The spawn location will be indicated on the map. Every 100 turns 1 Derelict squad will spawn on the left side of the map for each tunnel. After 1500 turns on the map, Warlord will tell Cogmind that it is time to retreat and to open the [[Redacted]]Cave Seals in [[Command]] for the final push. He, or a random Derelict if Warlord is not within range, will also give Cogmind a manual hack that can be applied to open the Cave Seals without any need for hackware.[[/Redacted]]
[[Heading:2]]Downside of event[[/Heading]]
As a result of the Warlord assault, additional patrols will be dispatched in [[Testing]], [[Quarantine]], and [[Access]]. Patrols will increase by 40% in these maps. This is most significant in Access, upping the Patrol count from 20 to 28. A few Warlord bots will also appear at the entrance to these maps.
[[Image]]Research Warlord Squads.png|A few Derelict squads[[/Image]]

[[Heading]]Derelict Forces[[/Heading]]
The Derelict forces consist of many unique bots during this event. All of them appear as non-controllable allies that do not generate any alert for Cogmind. There are 3 spawn points in the form of giant tunnels. Each tunnel is dug out by a [[Borebot]] escorted by 2 [[Samaritan|Samaritans]]. They will dig straight across the map to the right side. Tiles that are dug out by Borebots are safe to travel on and will not cave-in. Warlord attack squads can vary greatly in composition but are made up of the following bots:
[[List]][[Butcher (7)|Butchers]]|[[Commander|Commanders]]|[[Dragon|Dragons]]|[[Fireman (7)|Firemen]]|[[Guerrilla (7)|Guerrillas]]|[[Hydra|Hydras]]|[[Knight]]|[[Marauder (8)|Marauders]]|[[Martyr (7)|Martyrs]]|[[Savage (7)|Savages]]|[[Thug (7)|Thugs]]|[[Troll|Trolls]]|[[Wasp (7)|Wasps]]|[[Wizard (7)|Wizards]][[/List]]
[[Image]]Research Warlord Assault Squads.png|0b10 Warlord response assault squad[[/Image]]The 0b10 forces come in groups of 3 bots. There are always 2 (not necessarily of the same type) of [[Executioner]], [[Striker]], and [[D-83 Annihilator]] bots along with a [[C-45 Heavy ARC|Heavy ARC]] full of bots. They roam around the map looking for bots to fight.
[[Heading:2]][[DD-05H]][[/Heading]]
Sometimes DD-05H will appear a few hundred turns into the invasion. It will run toward Warlord and then follow Warlord around for the duration of the event. When this happens, the [[Tinkerer]] PL-HR7 will also appear at one of the invasion entrances on the left side of the map. PL-HR7 will drop a [[Warlord Statue]] that Cogmind can use.

[[Heading]]Encrypted Comm Array[[/Heading]]
If Cogmind has aided Warlord forces by compromising Garrisons and DSFs, Cogmind may get 1 or 2 additional special escort squads based on the force multiplier. These special squads will head straight to Cogmind's location and follow. The higher the force multiplier, the stronger the squads available for escort. The special squads are as follows:
[[List]]Bridgeowners Association: Trolls|Cat Herders: Wasps|Death Star: Martyrs|Department No. 42: Firemen|Offensive Angels: Wasps|Golden Rifles: Commanders, Geurrillas, Surgeons, and Thugs|Grunt Murderers: Thugs|Gunslingers: Guerrillas|Lair Dwellers: Hydras|Lobotomizers: Wizards|Lucky Slug: Marauders|Magnificent Bastards: Mutants|Metalheads: Mutants|Knights of the Pentagonal Table: Knights|Railsplitters: Guerrillas|Shockpunchers: Wizards|Smaug Morners: Dragons|The Professionals: Commanders, Guerrillas, Knights, Surgeons, Trolls, and Wizards|Vikings: Butchers|Viscera Detail: Butchers and Savages[[/List]]
This event tends to be great for Cogmind. The primary downsides is that the machine network turns off relatively early into the event and locating the desired exit can be a pain. Getting stuck in a bad position without any Derelict allies can also be painful since the assaults, particularly the prototype bots and demolishers, pack quite a punch. However, the large number of alert-free allies and free loot from the bots fighting is great to any build. Like the Revision 17 event, this event will also cause the maps to have no Heavies. Finding any exit is usually possible by following the assault dispatch notifications. Assaults will be dispatched out of any Garrison or exit. The only exits that assaults do not come from are Quarantine prefab exits. In that case, using other infowar like terrain scanning and drones is the best way to locate these exits.

Name: Warlord (Location)
Content:
The Warlord base is a [[Caves]] [[Branch]] that appears on -5 or -4 and is named after the eponymous bot [[Warlord]]. This map is home to a large number of [[Derelict|Derelicts]] allied with Warlord and ready to fight. This branch is much more combat-oriented than many of the other Caves branches, with large waves of [[0b10]] bots assaulting the base. Initially the map is totally safe and filled with friendly NPCs, but after one of several conditions is met a large assault will begin.

[[Heading]]Map Makeup[[/Heading]]

[[Heading:2]]Right Side[[/Heading]]
The right side of the map is the same every run. There is a small cave-like area with an exit just above the starting area. There are a few [[Dirty Bomb Trap|Dirty Bomb Traps]] spread around this section of the map, so be aware if Cogmind has any [[Corruption]].
[[Heading:2]]Entrances[[/Heading]]
There are two entrances into the base: The first has some doors blocking a large corruption-cleansing System Quarantine Field Array, some opened Blast Doors, and a second set of regular doors opening up into 2 [[Marauder (6)|Marauders]]. This entrance has a large number of [[Fire Trap|Fire Traps]] installed. The second way in is either on the top or the bottom of the map, hidden behind some fake walls. These will automatically open if approached from the inside of the base. Behind these fake walls are a set of Sealed Heavy Doors, followed by one more set of fake walls. If Cogmind is [[RIF]] aligned or has become hostile to the [[UFD]], they will be detected and the entire base will be turned hostile. This occurs no matter which entrance is taken. It is safe to get the corruption cleanse, but any further will be dangerous.

[[Heading:2]]Interior[[/Heading]]
The interior of the base is different every run, but there are always 3 guaranteed rooms in every run.
[[Heading:3]]Vortex Lab[[/Heading]]
The Vortex Lab which is locked behind Sealed Heavy Doors with a [[Terminal]] to open it next to them. Inside are some [[Tinkerer|Tinkerers]], a lore Terminal, and a random assortment of Vortex weaponry. There will always be at least one pair of weapons from the following list:
[[List]][[Vortex Cannon]]|[[Vortex Driver]]|[[Vortex Lance]]|[[Vortex Rail]]|[[Vortex Rifle]]|[[Vortex Shotgun]][[/List]]
There may also be a single [[Vortex Catalyst Activator]], and if this is a seed where the [[Exiles (Group)|Exiles]] abandoned their hideout, [[EX-DEC]] will be present along with a [[BFG-9k Vortex Edition]].

[[Heading:3]]Warlord's Throne Room[[/Heading]]
In this room is are Warlord himself, 6 [[Thug (7)|Thugs]], 2 [[Knight|Knights]], and [[God Mode (Fake)|Fake God Mode]].

[[Heading:3]]Warlord's Stash[[/Heading]]
The final room is Warlord's stash which is locked by [[Reinforced Walls|Sealed Heavy Doors]]. The nearby Terminal can be hacked open with a special code obtained at a Terminal in [[Data Miner (Location)]].
The contents of Warlord's stash will vary every game with only the Vortex Chain Reactor being guaranteed. The contents can be as follows:
[[List]](guaranteed) [[Vortex Chain Reactor]]|[[Adv. Remote Shield]] or [[Adv. Remote Force Field]]|[[Exp. Phase Shifter]], [[Exp. Targeting Computer]], or [[Exp. Cloaking Device]]|1-2 of one of [[Electron Diverter]], [[Imp. Diametric Drive]], or [[Cld. Impulse Thruster]]|1-2 of one of [[Exp. Myomer Leg]] or [[Enh. Biometal Leg]]|1-2 of [[Cld. Antigrav System]]|[[System Mapper]] or [[Ghost Barrier]]|[[Exp. Energy Well]], [[Exp. Matter Compressor]], [[Exp. Cooling System]], [[Exp. Coolant Injector]], or [[Adv. Cryofiber Web]]|[[Spectral Analyzer]], [[Exp. Target Analyzer]], [[Exp. Core Analyzer]], or [[Exp. Armor Integrity Analyzer]]|[[Thermal Barrier]], [[Exp. Focal Shield]], or [[System Purifier]][[/List]]


[[Heading]]Alignment - [[Warlord (Alignment)|Warlord]][[/Heading]]
After entering Warlord's throne room, he will explain his plan to attack upper 0b10. As long as he survives until Cogmind exits the map and the 0b10 forces attack, he will attack on -2 [[Research]]. This will occur even if you turn the Warlord forces hostile before exiting the map. Keep in mind, it is possible for a fast Flight build to leave before the assault begins which will prevent the invasion. Along with this Research event, there is another event in [[Command]] that this affects: [[Redacted]]When the Command cave seals are opened, [[Warlord (Command)]] will pop out along with various other Warlord-aligned Derelicts.[[/Redacted]] This alignment is incompatible with RIF or attacking [[Scraptown]] as Warlord will be hostile when entering the base. It is also incompatible with [[Imprint]] or [[UFD]] alignment, as Warlord will not be happy talking with Cogmind. If the [[Encrypted Comm Array]] has been obtained, Warlord will thank Cogmind for assisting his forces. At this point, no more forces will be summonable and the Array can be dropped.

[[Heading]]Notable Locations[[/Heading]]
[[Gallery]]Warlord Assembled Lab.png|[[Tinkerer]] examining some [[Assembled (4)|Assembled]]|Warlord Watcher Feeds Derelict.png|Tinkerer who claims to have discovered a way to download Watcher Feeds|Warlord Watcher Feeds Effect.png|Effects of previous "Watcher Feeds" hack|Warlord Dormant Derelicts.png|Dormant Derelicts that wake up after the invasion begins|Warlord Trapped Marauder.png|Unpowered Marauder built in a small room|Warlord Shooting Challenge.png|Thugs shoot some unpowered wild derelicts which power and become hostile|Warlord Dormant Thugs.png|A group of dormant thugs|Cogmind Dormant Prototype.png|Dormant Prototype bots can also appear, for example a [[Hydra]] here|Warlord Recruits.png|New Warlord recruits|Warlord Rewirable Bots.png|[[Surgeon (6)|Surgeons]] with various rewirable 0b10 bots|Warlord Sappers.png|[[Sapper|Sappers]] with [[Thermoblaster|Thermoblasters]], [[Mak. Ablative Armor]], and [[Sapper Charge|Sapper Charges]]|Warlord Hacking Lab.png|Terminals containing [[Garrison Access|Garrison]] Trojan hacks|Warlord Intel Room.png|Intel Terminals containing recon data|Warlord Garrison Intel.png|Lore Terminals with Garrison and Squad information|Warlord Prototype ID Bank.png|Terminal with Prototype IDs|Warlord Fabnet Lab.png|Lab with lore and information about Trojan(Fabnet) hack|Warlord Derelict Parts.png|Assorted Derelict parts on the ground|Warlord Signal Generators.png|Derelict with [[Signal Generator|Signal Generators]]|Warlord Wardrone Bay.png|Derelict with [[Wardrone Bay]]|Warlord Minesniffer Drone Bays.png|Tinkerer with [[Minesniffer Drone Bay|Minesniffer Drone Bays]]|Warlord Throwing Claymores.png|Tinkerer with [[RU-N14's Throwing Claymores v3]]|Warlord Relay Coupler.png|Wizards with a collection of [[Relay Couplers]]|Warlord Plasma Storm.png|Tinkerer with [[Plasma Storm]]|Warlord Great Nut Betrayer.png|Derelict betrayer who is about to be executed|Warlord Vortex Lab.png|Vortex Lab with assorted Vortex Weapons|Warlord Stash.png|Warlord's stash with various parts|Warlord Throne Room.png|Warlord in his throne room[[/Gallery]]

[[Heading]]0b10 Assault[[/Heading]]
There are several conditions that can kick off the 0b10 assault on Warlord's base:
[[List]]Moving 575 tiles
|Being on the map for 1300 turns
|Visiting Warlord in his throne room
|Opening up the Vortex Lab
|Destroying, in ways that are attributed to Cogmind, ~8 walls, doors or machines at any point vertically aligned and/or east of the main four-door entrance. Destruction from corruption triggering a Dirty Bomb Trap does not count, but destruction from corruption misfires do. When at least 4 but less than ~8 tiles or machines were destroyed, a warning announcement will appear: [[GameText]]Heightened seismic activity detected outside base. Stay alert for hostiles.[[/GameText]][[/List]]
After any of these conditions is met, large groups of 0b10 forces will come from an opening in either the top-right, middle-right, or bottom-right section of the map. These bots roam around the map randomly in groups, but usually come straight through the main entrance. When this happens, a large group of [[Bouncer|Bouncers]] will join the existing Marauder guards at the front gate. The first wave will usually be decimated by the entryway traps, but many more will follow.
There are a total of 14 assault waves, although it is highly recommended to leave the map before that many enemy bots appear. 10 turns after the first [[GameText]]MAIN.C incursion imminent. Mobilizing sentries[[/GameText]] announcement, the first wave will appear with the announcement [[GameText]]Northeast/Southeast/Central east cave walls breached[[/GameText]] indicating where the spawn location is. From then on, waves will spawn in 100 turn increments. Every 90 turns will give a [[GameText]]MAIN.C reinforcements approaching through caves, arriving soon[[/GameText]] announcement, and 10 turns after that the waves will spawn with an announcement of the wave composition. 4 squads can spawn per wave.
[[Image]]Warlord Assault Wave.png|A typical assault wave. Pictured are Saboteur, Hunter, Melee, and Grunt squads with Prototype support[[/Image]]
[[Heading:2]]Assault Contents[[/Heading]]
The hostile forces are made up of different types of squads, each with their own squad leader:
[[List]]Behemoth Squad: [[Behemoth|Behemoths]]|Demolisher Squad: [[Demolisher|Demolishers]] with a [[Protector]]|Grunt Squad: [[Grunt|Grunts]], sometimes with a [[Specialist]] squad leader or [[Protector]] support|Hunter Squad: [[Hunter|Hunters]] and [[Swarmer|Swarmers]]|Melee Squad: [[Duelist|Duelists]], [[Brawler|Brawlers]] with a [[Protector]]|Mixed Squad: [[Grunt|Grunts]], [[Duelist|Duelists]], [[Brawler|Brawlers]], and [[Mechanic|Mechanics]]|Programmer Squad: [[Programmer|Programmers]]|Saboteur Squad: [[E-15 Imp|Imps]] and [[Grunt|Grunts]]|Swarmer Squad: [[Swarmer|Swarmers]][[/List]]
Sometimes these squads can spawn with "Prototype Support". When this happens, [[Executioner]] and [[Striker]] bots can also appear as part of a squad.
[[Heading:2]]Assisting[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Warlord Wall Lure.png|Luring hostiles around the wall[[/Image]]Staying and fighting near the main entryway is one of the best approaches to fighting the waves off. Join in with [[Launchers]] if you have them, but make sure to watch out for friendly fire. There is a bit of leeway, but hitting allies too many times will be considered a betrayal. Demolishers and Programmers are the highest priority targets since they can cause a lot of damage with Launchers and robot hacking respectively. Throwing Claymores and the Vortex Catalyst Activator that can both be obtained on this map are great options to destroy waves with ease. [[Visual Processing Units]] coupled with long ranged weapons are another good option to sit back and snipe bots from outside their typical range. The entrance defense is quite strong and will perform well most of the time. However, a squad of Programmers with an unlucky chain-assimilation of bots or some unchecked Demolishers will quickly tear any defense to pieces.
Even a build with little offensive power can help out in this part of the defense. Getting spotted first will cause hostiles to prioritize Cogmind for a while, even if they are getting shot by something else. This means that the Warlord bots can blast away all the hostiles while they are trying to run after you. This can work well for combat builds too, especially for combat hostiles without launchers of their own.
[[Heading:2]]Counterattack[[/Heading]]
In between the 4th and 5th waves, a Derelict will appear next to Cogmind to leave the base with the counterattack for cover. At this point, the majority of the combat Derelicts except for the guard Marauders and Bouncers will begin to head outside of the base. The strength of the counterattacks depends on a lot of factors. If the defense falters early on, the counterattack can get caught up fighting a bunch of squads and never make it out the entrance. Their tendency to trickle to the fight can be a big weakness if the hostiles are bunched up and can quickly take out Derelicts one at a time. On the other hand, [[Sapper|Sappers]] will dramatically increase the strength of any counterattack and can destroy big groups of bots on their own. 
The counterattack is usually a good time to exit the map whether it's successful or not. For airborne builds especially, even if the counterattack dies early on it can serve as a good distraction as you fly by.
[[Heading:2]]Base Infiltration[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Warlord Enhanced Allies.png|Enhanced Allies[[/Image]]In between the 7th and 8th assault waves is the final event of the map. A random spot in the Warlord base will be infiltrated and hostile assault squads will begin to appear from that location too with the announcement [[GameText]]Base interior infiltrated, regroup at designated outer cave rendezvous points[[/GameText]]. At the same time, a friendly group of 3 [[Enhanced Grunt|Enhanced Grunts]] and 3 [[Enhanced Demolisher|Enhanced Demolishers]] will teleport into Warlord's throne room to assist. 2 of the Demolishers will immediately head toward the exit while the remaining bots follow Warlord around. At this point, all surviving Derelicts will head toward Warlord as he makes his way over to the map exit.
This is the last chance to exit the map with any amount of assistance. With assaults pouring in from the main entrance and a spot in the base itself, it is time to go. The Enhanced Demolishers have incredible loot including [[Cmb. Linear Gravjet|Cmb. Linear Gravjets]], [[Centrium Medium Armor Plating]], [[Coolant Network]], and the unique [[Chain Missile Launcher]].

Name: Wasp
Content: Wasps are a [[Bot Groups|bot group]] of [[Flight Units|flying]] [[Derelict]] combat bots armed with Derelict [[Ballistic Guns]]. They are the Derelict version of the [[0b10]] [[Swarmer]] class, and as such, are individually quite frail and nonthreatening bots, but can be more powerful in groups. Wasps are common bots that show up in many different types of Derelict encounters and events.

Name: Wastes
Content:
Wastes is a [[0b10]]-controlled sub-floor in Factory that appears on most floors between -7 and -4. It can only be entered when Cogmind triggers a [[Chute Trap]]. Cogmind will get dropped in instantly. Any bots that have been dropped into chutes previously will be present on the map. Any nearby allies will drop in over time. Wastes can be a very brutal map for an unprepared player thanks to the 6 hostile [[C-40 Crusher|Crushers]] that can crush Cogmind's build in a few hits. There is an EMP that is on in some Wastes maps that fires every 100 turns and adds between 5 to 10% [[Corruption]] to Cogmind. This corruption can be reduced by EM [[Resistance Devices]] and prevented with [[Dynamic Insulation Systems]]. There are various broken, faulty, or otherwise low integrity parts scattered on the ground. These parts can be up to 2 ratings out of depth and can be good to try to [[Repair Station|repair]] or [[Scanalyzer|scan]], and [[Fabricator|fabricate]].
The layout of this map is semi-fixed. The entrance, exits, and general layouts of the map are similar, although the exact layout can vary a bit in which way paths are connected. There are wide 4 tile corridors that sometimes have 8 by 8 tile wide dead ends on the far ends of the map. Cogmind spawns on the left side, and the exit will always be in an 8 by 8 tile section on the right side of the map.

[[Heading]]Lore[[/Heading]]
[[Lore]]0b10 Records|Waste[[/Lore]]

[[Heading]]Variations[[/Heading]]
[[Image]]Wastes Allies.png|[[Derelict|Derelicts]] hiding in the walls waiting to attack[[/Image]][[Image]]Wastes Allies Waiting.png|Allies that invaded chutes waiting for Cogmind[[/Image]]
There are 4 primary variations of Wastes:
[[List]]Standard: The EMP is on, Crushers are present, and there are no allies.|EMP + allies: The EMP is on, Crushers are present, and there are Derelict allies hiding in the walls. The Derelicts will burst out of their hiding spot when coming near them. There is a small stash of weapons and armor in their hiding spot.|No EMP + allies: The EMP is disabled, Crushers are present, and there are Derelict allies hiding in the walls.|No EMP + raided: The EMP is disabled but there are no alive Crushers or Derelicts on the map. Some damaged Crusher loot and broken Crushers and Derelicts are present. Broken crushers may suddenly reactivate if Cogmind gets too close.|No EMP + raided + allies: The EMP is disabled, there are no alive Crushers, but there is a group of Derelicts waiting for Cogmind.[[/List]]

[[Heading]]Strategy[[/Heading]]
See [[Strategy/Maps/Wastes]].

Name: Watcher
Content:
Watchers are [[Hover Units|hovering]] [[0b10]] non-combat bots that report hostiles upon visual contact to other allied bots. Watchers have a large distress signal area of effect compared to other bots. If Cogmind has a Watcher in line of sight then an animation will play when the Watcher alerts other bots. Combat bots and [[Operator|Operators]] will all be alerted to your location when this happens, after which combat bots will pursue and Operators will attempt to report hostiles at their [[Terminal]]. Watchers have [[Visual Processing Units]] that allow them to see bots at a larger range than the usual 16 tile range of vision, that can be desirable to loot from them. Watchers also have a unique [[Sensor Arrays|Sensor]] jamming effect while Cogmind is within a certain distance of them.
Watchers are arguably the most troublesome non-combat bot class in the game. Their large visual range, large reporting range, and sensor jamming abilities cause a wide variety of problems for many different build types. The most effective tool against them are [[Transmission Jammers]] which will block their reporting ability. While a Watcher is jammed, it is possible to tell if bots are nearby. If there are no bots nearby, nothing will happen when the Watcher is in range. However, if there are bots nearby, there will be a constant game log message of [[GameText]][Watcher type] distress signal jammed.[[/GameText]]
Watchers are quite difficult to kill, especially the W-44 Eye variant. Their naturally higher than usual avoidance and propensity for running away makes them hard to hit, and a Watcher that lives to run away is a Watcher that continues to summon more trouble from far away. For airborne builds, any melee weapons are reasonable choices to kill them, especially if positioning for a [[Sneak Attack]]. For grounded builds, many EM weapons can kill a Watcher in one or two hits, especially with the high amount of corruption gained. However, due to their low integrity, any weapons will easily destroy them.
[[Gallery]]Watchers.png|All Watcher variants and colors[[/Gallery]]

Name: Weapons
Content:
Weapon components allow robots to deal damage or otherwise perform some utility.

Weapons can be from 9 general categories: [[Ballistic Cannons]], [[Energy Cannons]], [[Ballistic Guns]], [[Energy Guns]], [[Launchers]], [[Slashing Weapons]], [[Piercing Weapons]], [[Impact Weapons]], [[Special Melee Weapons]], and [[Special Weapons]].

[[Heading]]Multi-Weapon Volleys[[/Heading]]

Most weapons can be fired together as a volley, excluding Special Weapons, Special Melee Weapons, and [[Guided Weapons]]. Multiple Slashing, Piercing, and Impact melee weapons can be made to fire in one volley, although any weapons beyond the first are restricted to chance-based follow-up attacks.

[[Heading:2]]Volley Time Costs[[/Heading]]

Each weapon in a ranged multi-weapon volley will increase the volley's total time cost, with each weapon being more efficient time-wise:
[[Table]]Number of Weapons|Time cost||1|200||2|300||3|325||4|350||5|375||6+|400[[/Table]]
This is then modified by the sum of the delay stats of every weapon in the volley, then by the time cost reduction of an equipped [[Weapon Cyclers|Weapon Cycler]], [[Quantum Capacitor]], or [[Launcher Loader]], when applicable. A single volley may not cost less than 25 time units.

[[Heading:2]]Follow-Up Attacks[[/Heading]]

When multiple melee weapons are fired in a single volley, the first will always fire, and any others will have an independent chance to make a follow-up attack. Follow-up attacks are more likely when the primary weapon is slower than a given backup melee weapon. The chance may also be affected by supporting utilities. Follow-ups will add half the delay stat of the weapon that is following-up to the total time cost of the volley, before the time cost reduction of any [[Actuators]].

[[Heading:2]]Recoil[[/Heading]]

Certain weapons (Especially ballistic ones) suffer from recoil. The sum of every other weapon's recoil will be assessed as a penalty to each weapon in a volley containing weapon(s) suffering from recoil.

[[Heading]]Energy/Ballistic Gun Mechanics[[/Heading]]

If a volley is comprised exclusively of ballistic and/or energy guns and its original target is destroyed, a secondary target may be selected, prioritizing the most easily hit armed and active hostile in range. New targets may continue to be selected until no weapons remain in the volley. This mechanic is also available to melee follow-ups, and can be expanded to any weapon with use of a [[Heavy Servo Lattice]] or [[Spoiler]][[VL-GR5's Timing Chip]][[/Spoiler]]. However, unlike every other weapons, guns cannot cause overflow damage when damage dealt is greater than the target components integrity. Overflow damage is sent to a second part according to standard coverage rules, unless the destroyed part was armor, and overflow damage is always sent to armor if any is present.

[[Heading]]Weapon Types[[/Heading]]

[[Heading:2]][[Electromagnetic Weapons]]/[[Thermal Weapons]][[/Heading]]

Energy weapons generally have a shorter range, but benefit from a more easily predictable damage potential and little or no recoil. Thermal damage also generally transfers heat to the target, and may cause meltdowns in hot enough targets. Electromagnetic damage is capable of causing system corruption in targets. Anywhere from 50-150% of damage is applied as system corruption. EM damage is additionally capable of disrupting hit parts or even robot cores, as well as causing chain reactions in target power components. 

[[Heading:2]][[Ballistic Weapons]][[/Heading]]

Ballistic weapons generally have a longer effective range and more destructive critical strikes, but suffer from less predictable damage and high recoil. Some kinetic projectiles, especially hypervelocity variants, are capable of penetrating one or more consecutive targets. Kinetic cannon hits also blast usable matter off target robots and have a damage-equivalent chance to cause knockback, with a (10 - range) * 5 modifier and a +/-10% per size class (Tiny/Small/Medium/Large/Huge) difference between the target and medium size (targets knocked into another robot may also damage and displace it). The amount of matter created per cannon projectile impact is randomized from between zero up to the absolute value of the weapon's salvage modifier, but only applies for those weapons with a negative salvage modifier below -2.

[[Heading:2]][[Launchers]][[/Heading]]

Launchers may deal either electromagnetic or explosive damage.  Damage from launchers is spread across targets in their area of effect, dividing damage into separate chunks before affecting a robot, where each chunk selects its own target part (though they may overlap). Launchers also suffer from damage falloff: targets at the edge of the area of effect will sustain less damage then targets near the center. Explosive launchers carry high salvage penalties and will tend to destabilize hit terrain. Electromagnetic launchers can initiate chain reactions in power components attached to [[Cogmind]] or on the ground and disrupt hit components or robot cores.

[[Heading:2]][[Impact Weapons]][[/Heading]]

Impact melee weapons have a damage-equivalent chance to cause knockback, with a +/-10% per size class (T/S/M/L/H) difference between attacker and target. Targets knocked into another robot may also damage and displace it. A robot hit by another displaced robot has a chance to itself be displaced and sustain damage, where the chance equals the original knockback chance further modified by +/-10% per size class difference between the blocking robot and the knocked back robot, and the resulting damage equals the original damage inflicted by the weapon after applying the +10% robot analysis damage modifier if applicable, further divided by the blocker size class if that class is greater than 1 (where Medium = 2, and so on).

Impact weapons ignore relative coverage when determining which components to affect, and are therefore effective at destroying fragile systems regardless of armor and other protection. By ignoring coverage, there is an equal chance for an attack to hit any given part, where each slot of a multislot part also has a separate and equivalent chance to be hit. A target's core also counts as one slot for that purpose. In addition, for every component crushed by an impact, its owner's system is significantly corrupted (+25-150%), though electromagnetic resistance can help mitigate this effect.

[[Heading:2]][[Slashing Weapons]][[/Heading]]

Slashing melee weapons are generally very damaging, and most are also capable of severing components from a target without destroying them.

[[Heading:2]][[Piercing Weapons]][[/Heading]]

Piercing melee weapons inflict less collateral damage, but are more likely to hit a robot's core, and get double the melee momentum damage bonus. The core exposure bonus is 8%, the same as an [[Exp. Core Analyzer]]

[[Heading:2]][[Special Weapons]] and [[Special Melee Weapons]][[/Heading]]

Special weapons are usually intended to serve some utility rather than directly deal damage.
Groups: Autonomous Weapons,Guided Weapons,Overloadable Weapons,Phasic Weapons,Vortex Weapons
Supergroups: Ballistic Weapons,Datajacks,Electromagnetic Weapons,Energy Cannons,Energy Guns,Hypervelocity Weapons,Launchers,Melee Weapons,Special Melee Weapons,Special Weapons,Thermal Weapons

Name: Wheels
Content:
Wheels are the most fragile ground propulsion type, but have a lower overweight penalty than any other type of propulsion. They are commonly used by (and available from) almost all non-combat 0b10 bots, other than [[Hauler|Haulers]].

Because of the low overweight penalty, it is viable for bots to use wheels even if they are several times overweight.

The low overweight penalty of wheels, and their ready availability from the ubiquitous green bots, gives them some niches:
[[List]]
As a sole propulsion type for bots that carry massive inventories, including certain [[RIF]] builds.
|In combination with [[Treads]] to form a [[I]]half-track[[/I]] configuration, where both wheels and treads are equipped at once. [[Cogmind]] activates wheels outside combat to benefit from the fast movement speed, and treads in combat for the knockback immunity and recoil reduction. Half-tracking is useful for bots that have not found enough spare treads, to reduce the churn of treads. The ease of obtaining wheels makes them a viable secondary propulsion type.
|As backup propulsion. If all of Cogmind's propulsion is destroyed, it may have an extremely slow movement speed on core propulsion. Equipping just one wheel will often reduce the movement delay to a manageable amount.
[[/List]]
The main downside of wheels compared to other ground propulsion is their fragility. Cogmind can easily loot replacement wheels from green bots, but will still go through wheels fairly quickly.
